Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed!”
Reviews.Author: HomeNetworker
Reviews.Content: Other than a few minor maintenance needs on doors that drug hard against the floor, the place and people were beautiful. Nice view overlooking the water and surrounding country side. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was better than most places that I've stayed at before with real food and choices.

Reviews.Title: “great all around”
Reviews.Author: GNRoney
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more of a bed and breakfast and it was lovely all around. I wasn't quite sure what to expect and I wanted to make this a great anniversary trip for my husband and myself. They have beach chairs and towels for you in each room, as well as a cooler. We rented a car, which I would highly recommend to fully appreciate the island. We packed a cooler and the chairs and threw them in the jeep and took off every day. The breakfast was great and the service wonderful. They even have lunches for you that you can pack to take with you, but we chose to explore the local fare such as sol food (sold out of an abandoned truck). The owners invited us with a few other couples to have a cocktail on Monday evening and the view from their room is spectacular and the company was great. We drove up to the W to see what I almost picked. It is more of a resort and looked lovely, but it was in an area of Vieques that we didn't care as much for. I absolutely loved our trip and wouldn't change a thing except to stay longer than 6 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusanFitz
Reviews.Content: Hacienda is a small, under 20 rooms, boutique hotel located in Vieques, PR. Rooms are lovely, many with own private balconies, full breakfast served daily. Breakfast always includes, juice, fruit, eggs, yummy jams, toast plus a special every day. Laid back, quiet enviroment with staff ready to help and answer any questions you might have. Beautiful pool with views of ocean, mountains and wild horses. Island is very laid back, local folks very appreciative of tourists, not at all commercial.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable vacation- would definitely recommend and return”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastTravelers30
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a fabulous stay - as two adults and a teenager, we stayed in a two-room suite. The suite on the top floor has very tall ceilings and great airflow- we only used the air conditioner once and turned it off after determining it really wasn't necessary. At night there are a lot of creature noises, so if you are a sensitive sleeper you might want the a/c. The location of this hotel is superior - located very close to Esperanza, which is where we chose to enjoy most of our meals. Looking back, had we picked a hotel farther from Esperanza, I think I would not have enjoyed our trip as much. You must rent a car while here to fully experience the island. The beach down the hill from the hotel is great for exploring, though I would not recommend it for swimming due to rocks and sea urchins. With a car, there are other beaches very close that are perfect for swimming, so I wouldn't consider this an issue. The hotel was very charming- wonderful setting, great staff- Ivan actually reserved our flights from the mainland and our car rental and was so patient with our multiple questions and requests. Teresa arranged for dinner for us for several nights. The breakfast staff are so pleasant and accomodating. Zack, the resident sheepdog exuded charm and provided entertainment while "herding" horses off the property and graciously letting everyone pet him at every turn. The staff and the owners really make the property. We found the pool plenty warm enough to swim in. There are floats that can be used for lounging in the pool and reading a book all day without fully committing to getting in the water if temperature is an issue. There were no tvs in the room and wi-fi did not work unless in the library. From my perspective this was a positive - teenager read 3 books in a week which would not have likely happened with a tv or wi-fi! It was also great because I could truly unplug from work unless I really needed to check in. Breakfast was delicious. Spicy hash browns were a favorite of mine mixed with scrambled eggs. Our daughter's only complaint was that the specials were typically egg based and she would have loved more pancake / waffle based specials. There were cranberry walnut pancakes on special one day we were there, served with Vermont Maple Syrup. The packed lunches provided by the hotel were great- a generous amount of food and I would highly recommend. You order in the kitchen the night before and pick up in the morning. We only did this one day, but probably should have done it every day given how much we seemed to spend on lunch when we went out! Overall, I can see why this hotel is #1 on Trip Advisor, however if you are looking for an experience like at the W- you won't find it here. In my opinion, you will have a better time at Hacienda Tamarindo (and we toured the W and had lunch there), but it is a very different experience - no comparison. I say this only to give context to the review. The W looked to me to be more "luxury" but luxury that could have been anywhere. I would describe Hacienda Tamarindo as rustic island chic - an authentic vacation. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A mini paradise away from it all”
Reviews.Author: Bruce88
Reviews.Content: After making new friends, we decided at the last minute to stay the evening after taking the ferry over from Fajardo. Leaving our paid for Rio Mar for one night wasn't as traumatic as I had expected. Matter of fact, I was more relaxed there than on mainland Puerto Rico. The owner (a Vermont native) was very pleasant and efficient. The rooms and bathrooms were great however the air conditioning was LOUD. The breakfast was to die for - just wonderful. Pool and views were incredible. There was a restaurant just a few hundred meters away which served some of the best mohitos we had during our stay. At $200/Night it was a great break from our vacation? What did I just say?

Reviews.Title: “people are very nice but there is something vaguely depressing about the place and the island”
Reviews.Author: tannerman80
Reviews.Content: It's hard to criticize people who are kind and do everything right. With that said, we found the Hacienda to have a kind of dark, dilapidated feel to it. Some might call it funky, but it's not quite that. We had what I would probably call the best room in the place, with a balcony. However, the view towards the sea is kind of scrubby and the deck chairs painfully uncomfortable. The room itself is dark and when the weather turned bad, it was not a place to spend time in. Both my husband and I felt confined. The bed is uncomfortable. The quality of the linens is poor and the mattress is just not inviting. I know to expect mosquitos here and there, but there were a significant number and we got quite bitten--even with the doors closed. The catch-22, is that by closing the door, the room feels like a cell. The bathroom is barely tolerable. Tiny with a sink outside in the room. The breakfasts are well-meaning--everyone is well-meaning--but really unimaginative and we chose to eat at the one other place "in town" that serves breakfast. They do pack a picnic lunch--which is a benefit. Although, again, it is just OK. We found Vieques itself, to be somewhat depressing. There are many properties for sale and even the Hacienda has a for sale sign up, although I didn't inquire if indeed it is. The island used to be off-limits and used for test-bombing. When it ultimately opened for tourism, it just doesn't seem to have come into its own. Believe me, neither my husband nor myself like high-rise, glitzy hotels, however, there is a vast difference between that and a place that feels alive. Even the beaches, which are indeed deserted, which should be nice right? Well, they seem odd. There is one beach with a sign that says something to the effect of: do not tresspass into the woods because there may be buried explosives. We took a kayaking excursion to the Bioluminescent Bay with Abe's. I don't recommend them. Our guide was sarcastic, complained he had not eaten, and people were herded along like numbers which ruined the beauty of the experience. I hear there is a glass-bottomed kayak experience. I would suggest this instead. Again, there is nothing terrible at all about the Hacienda and nothing terrible about the island, it is just feels charmless, colorless and semi-abandoned(as opposed to romantic and remote). On the other hand, it could be just us. I know that many people who have come here love the experience. Certainly, the price is right. However, we are seasoned travellers and tend to take the road less travelled and this is definitely a no repeat for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: manhattantwo
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at HT for five nights and loved it. The rooms were beautiful--we had a room with a view of the ocean, and our adult son had a less expensive but equally lovely standard room--and the services are top notch. Linda provides so many thoughtful and convenient extras that made our stay so nice: the open bar for sodas, drinks, and snacks at any hour, delicious box lunches to take to the beach, chairs and beach towels...great! The hotel is a short walk or drive into Esperanza where the action is, and there is a path down to the shore which was my favorite "beach" of all....wild and secluded. Some guests told us they had been coming to Vieques for years and after they tried HT they never stayed anywhere else. We agree!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Mir0215
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hacienda in March and we loved the experience. The manager was helpful, friendly and really authentic. He even gave us a suite even though we didn't pay for that. The view to the ocean is absolutely amazing. However, the location is a bummer: if you don't have a car, you'll need to call a cab every time (which isn't hard, and the manager helped us with that). So if you want a really relaxing hotel experience, Hacianda is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!”
Reviews.Author: Steven A
Reviews.Content: Vieques' Hacienda Tamarindo, located just outside the very funky beach town of Esperanza, is a welcome respite for any traveller having made the journey. Truth be told, I'm a repeat visitor, having stayed here 11 times over as many years (this is being written at my breakfast table, so like the food, this review is being served up fresh). This might qualify me to observe the consistency and continuity of this charming B&B to which the management has adhered. I don't think Tripadvisor existed 11 years ago, but if it had, and I had written a review then, it would be pretty much the same as the one I write today. And from where I sit, that's all good. Many have written about the charming building in which Hacienda Tamarindo is housed, with the Tamarind tree rising up from the lobby and through the second-floor dining area (under which I am happy to be sitting). The pool is small but intimate, with an incredible view of green pastures, complete with wild horses, flowing down to meet the Atlantic Ocean. The rooms are tastefully and artfully decorated, and having stayed in several different rooms over the years, I can say that, while the views can change from room to room, the overall experience from each is on par with all. The breakfast that is served each morning is always excellent, and the staff has always been caring and attentive. There is an honor bar in the lobby (reminiscent of days gone by, when people actually trusted one another) that's stocked with a full assortment of waters, spirits, beer and wine. And the grounds are well kept and beautiful, with an occasional hammock here and there. Is it perfect? Well, no, but what is? However, to my mind, it approaches perfection in many ways, and while my wife and I could have stayed at many other places on Vieques over the years, Hacienda Tamarindo has kept us coming back, and will continue to do so. I have recommended HT to many friends over the years, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to you, Tripadvisor reader. Enjoy this tropical paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, relaxing retreat from the daily hub-bub”
Reviews.Author: Paul D
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Tamarindo is a lovely, friendly small hotel in a secluded spot on Vieques, yet within easy driving distance of wonderful beaches and fine dining. The hotel is tastefully decorated in a Caribbean motif, with an open architecture to take advantage of the cooling sea breezes that sweep across the hillside on which it is situated. Our room (which was the last one available at the time of our visit) was comfortable and good-sized, with a spectacular view of the water, as well as the hotel gardens and pool. The sumptuous breakfast each morning got us off to a good start each day, the owners and their staff were friendly and helpful in every way. Having no TV was a blessing, and the well-appointed library was equipped with an internet connection that allowed us to keep in touch when we wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not great”
Reviews.Author: lcsmith51
Reviews.Content: Our initial impression of the hotel was one of disappointment. Expectations were high after reading the reviews here. We had trouble getting from the airport to the hotel as the car rental agency was closed (we arrived at 6 pm) . We ended up sharing a publico but did not get to the hotel until after 7, very tired after traveling all day. In an interesting "welcome", the reception desk is behind a big clear plastic sliding window, giving more the impression that I was at a police station than an inn. The first order of business as part of our "welcome" is to pay our bill. Not just "we have you staying for 6 days at $300" like every other place I have ever stayed,but actually charging us for the next 6 days before we have even seen our room. We were not happy. All that said, we did get a little tour and the hotel is definitely quirky but cool and relaxing. The location is great and in the morning we saw the great views, including from our room. The room was clean but I agree with the other comment that the sheets are well-worn and don't stay on because the elastic is worn. The bath and lighting fixtures are dated/worn, as well. It's great that they give you beach towels, beach chairs and a cooler but the chairs are also well-worn. Overall, I get the sense that updating is not a high priority. Also, bring your own shampoo and lotion. There is a plastic dispenser in the shower for soap and shampoo that is not very good. The water pressure and hot water are great though. Breakfast was very good, and the fresh juices were great. Expected more of a fruit selection, since two of the days the only available fruit was: bananas. Our server was very friendly and the coffee is really good! By the end of our stay we had settled into the vibe of the Hacienda and enjoyed ourselves a lot. I think we would stay there again, but would go into it with lower expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Larry1224
Reviews.Content: The hacienda is built around a big old tamarind tree which rises into the second story dining area and creates a wonderful island feeling. The staff was extremely friendly and cheerful. Could use a hot tub with a sunset view (the pool is not heated and doesn't face the late day sun).

Reviews.Title: “Our perfect week in Vieques”
Reviews.Author: motherofPearl007
Reviews.Content: It's a terrible conflict to want, on one hand, to share the excitement of finding a most excellent hotel in a magnificent place, while on the other hand, worrying that there will be a stampede and we'll never be able to get another reservation...but since Vieques isn't all that easy to get to, there will (we hope) be room for us at the Hacienda Tamarindo. The highest praise we can give to a vacation spot is - wish we could stay another week - and this lovely hotel earns it. If you are looking for a lovely, low key and non-glitzy place to spend your vacation, look no further. Our hosts Linda and Burr attended to our every need. Delicious breakfasts, beautiful views and just out of the way enough for a week of peace and quiet. Make sure to book early and to reserve a jeep at the same time. Take care to bring bug spray if you are out after dusk - the sand flees at the beach are voracious. Vieques is not for everybody. We kept referring to it as the anti-St Barths. I wouldn't go there with kids - many flights and not enough for them to do.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: pbeebrooklyn
Reviews.Content: The Hacienda was a wonderful home base for our 5 day exploration of Vieques. It's in a great location. Only a short drive to Esperanza where you will find a few decent restaurants. And from Esperanza it's a hop, skip, and a jump to Sun Beach- one of Vieques many fabulous beaches. All of the staff from the front desk to the kitchen staff were lovely. Helpful and accommodating even in a crisis (there was an island wide black out while we were there but because of the Hacienda's generator we weren't effected). The owners, Linda and Burr and their dog, Zach, were a warm presence. We did, however, get a little tired of the rather boring breakfast. It was tasty but it could use a little more creativity. We loved the box lunches in the knapsacks. Once we had our knapsacks, beach chairs, towels and coolers stocked with water (all courtesy of the Hacienda) we were off for the day. The beaches are amazing. You don't want to leave at the end of the day -let alone the end of your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “The Great Escape!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara H
Reviews.Content: We found Hacienda Tamarindo online when we planned a getaway to Puerto Rico and wanted an "eco-adventure" on the world famous Bioluminescent Bay there on Vieques. The island vibe is totally laid back. No hassle, no pressure, no night life --but ohhhh the total relaxation on an easy going little island only 20 mins. via Cape Air. Hacienda Tamarindo has an upscale, friendly "flip-flops" all day kind of atmosphere. A Tamarindo tree grows through the roof in the tasteful, eclectic lobby. Their big, low-key bear of a dog lays around the place but never bothers anyone. Delicious breakfasts prepared for us on the outdoor tiled veranda and a do-it-yourself bar downstairs in the living room area. Spectacular breeze off the ocean + awesome view = the best getaway we've ever had for total relaxation!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Destination Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Advntr_grl
Reviews.Content: We had such a beautiful, laid back, and relaxing stay at the Hacienda Tamarindo for our friends wedding. The place has such charm with beautiful views of the ocean. The staff was lovely on all levels. The breakfast was good (especially the oatmeal and I was never a huge fan until I had it here- wish I got the recipe). They also had a great juice selection (passion, tamarindo, etc). There were beach chairs, beach towels, and even a cooler in our room to use for the beaches which was great since the beaches are so secluded. If you dont feel like going to the beach the hammock and pool was a great place to relax. I would definitely recommend this place for a laid back destination wedding. My friends got married on a beach near by and then had an amazing, beautiful reception/party at the Hacienda after the cermony. A little side note: Please remember this is the carribean and there are going to be bugs and little critters that may get into your room. Skin so soft worked the best for me to keep the bites away and any bites that were obtained were well worth it :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyingDP
Reviews.Content: We arranged a last minute stay over Christmas for a week. The staff were fantastic and friendly, helping with rental car (a must on this island) and connecting flight suggestions beforehand, and couldn't have been better on check-in and during our stay. The property is gorgeous with views and a pool, and the building charming. The rooms have ceiling fans and A/C (although we left ours off) and have louvered, screened windows which lets you sleep with the gentle sound of the wind blowing through the palm trees. Breakfast was great and you can order a travel cooler with lunch made from the kitchen to take to the beach. Whilst not in town or by the beach, Esperanza is only a 3 minute drive and everything else is not far. This is not a glitzy hotel - for that stay at the W - but it is beautifully appointed and friendly and was perfect for us. My wife and I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Total relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Marweerita
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Tamarindo is a delightful inn near the village of Esperanza. The staff is very friendly and accomodating, the atmosphere is peaceful and low key, and the setting is beautiful with wonderful views of the Carribean. Our room was very comfortable, not fancy, with louvered French windows that opened up to a view of the sea. Breakfast was included and made to order. Picnic lunches for the next day may be ordered. We did this one day and ate it by the beautiful pool under the verandah. Perfect! A very relaxing place to stay. We will go back next winter, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kuhkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed during our honeymoon and had a spectacular time. I gave a 4 on rooms because they are not super super luxurious, but it was everything we could want. If you are looking for over the top, go with the w but tamarindo was wonderful for us

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, wonderful view, terrific breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: Sherry S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely, small hotel over Christmas. The staff there helped us secure a low airfare to Vieques and a rental car, which is most important to have on this island. Although not located on the beach, it has a terrific view of the Caribbean, cool breezes and a pretty pool with fountain. The hotel is outside the busy section of Esperanza which contributes to the peaceful, quiet experience. We were given beach chairs, towels and access to books, magazines and a computer. There is some wifi available, but it is not constant. The breakfasts were delicious and if you request it, the friendly staff will pack you a picnic lunch in a backpack complete with ice packs. We enjoyed everything about the hotel, but even with insect repellant, we received a large number of mosquito bites. All of the restaurants are open air, so it is more of an island problem. I would definitely recommend this really charming hotel, just be diligent in your use of insect repellant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Inn”
Reviews.Author: Iguana_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located in a quite spot with beautiful views of the Caribbean coastline. The staff is very friendly, and our room, with a balcony view of the ocean, was extremely pleasant. The room includes breakfast, which was delicious and plentiful!

Reviews.Title: “THE best place I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Steve K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (Amber, her review is below) stayed here for a week in early November with 30 of our closest friends and wedding guests. We had the time of our lives. The Hacienda was homely, relaxing, accommodating, and was the perfect place for us. Linda, Burr, and the rest of the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The pool is a ton of fun with great views, and all of the rooms were clean and spacious. We stayed in the suit, the Casita Linda and it was perfect. Granted, there were mosquitoes here and there, but we did have a habit of leaving the door open as people would come and go to the pool. Some bug spray will take care of that. Make sure you take advantage of the breakfast. Easily some of the best food we had on the island. I am still waking up wanting some spicy hash browns and wheat toast! Last but not least, Zach, is one of the coolest dogs around. Being pet owners, we missed our 2 dogs while we were on vacation but having Zach around made it a bit easier. If you're going to Vieques and you're looking for a place to stay where the staff is down-to-earth and want that homely feel, make sure you stay at the Hacienda. In fact, even if you aren't staying in Vieques but you are planning a trip to San Juan, make it a point to visit the island for just 1 day. Staying at the Hacienda is worth the trip alone. - Steve

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service and Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: Because our scheduled arrival at Vieques was late in the afternoon (after the rental car agency had closed), the staff had arranged to have our rental car available for us at the hotel. Our adventure started right away - when no taxis arrived after 15 minutes waiting, Jim, the front desk manager, provided names of several drivers, and we were quickly able to find one who came to pick us up. Our room had a nice view of the Carribbean. It was very homey and comfortable. We had a corner room, and had a nice cross-breeze that kept us comfortable at night. The staff was very friendly and helped us find great snorkeling locations. We really enjoyed the morning breakfasts, as well as the box lunches that you could order for an additional fee. The swimming pool was large and great for swimming laps, and also had a great view of the sea. The only downside (and this wasn't the hotel's fault) was that we could hear some distant loud music from the bars in Esperanza, although that was a very minor issue. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hacienda Tamarindo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice touches in a small inn on a beautiful island”
Reviews.Author: Wilmettetraveler1995
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hacienda Tamarindo in early December. Despite dire predictions on weather.com, the weather was very nice. We only had rain one night, while eating dinner. The Inn has many gracious touches, including beach chairs, a cooler, and beach towels in the room. The morning full breakfast on the patio is a lovely touch, and provides excellent value. The pool is quite lovely and overlooks the Caribbean. The owners were gracious and charming and made some excellent suggestions on restaurants. Jim (who worked at the front desk) was particularly helpful and always gave us good information on where to go and what to see. Vieques is a beautiful, wild island. Driving is not for the faint of heart. The roads are narrow and rutted, vegetation grows abundantly, and horses tend to wander about nearly everywhere. But a car is a must! The Hacienda is about a mile from the smaller of the two towns on Vieques, and there is a fairly nice selection of places to eat there. Our personal favorite was the Tradewinds (recommended by Burr, the Inn's owner). The food is very good, the service is pleasant and the views are outstanding (right over the Caribbean). If you are looking for luxury and are used to 5 star resorts, then don't go to Vieques. With the possible exception of The W (on the windward side of the island), you won't find it. However, if you want to go to unspoiled beaches and enjoy some solitude, this may be the place. The staff at the Inn took care of all details for us, including having a rental car at the Inn for us when we checked in (we arrived at the airport at about 6:00 p.m., apparently too late for the rental car facility to be open). Getting to the Inn from the airport was challenging. Be forewarned, you have to call a cab from a list they provide. Our driver, Jorge, was very nice and recommended we go the town square on Saturday in Isabel Segunda to see the tree lighting. That was the only bit of "culture" we ever saw (as most places are run by and staffed by Americans). The Christmas tree was entirely comprised of water and pop bottles wired together! Very clever and actually pretty. The square was crowded and everyone seemed to be having a great time. We went back there a few nights later and it was nearly empty, but we went into the Catholic church by the square, where they were singing the rosary in Spanish. We were graciously welcomed to join and it was quite lovely. We went on the much hyped kayak trip on the bio-luminescent bay. Interesting but not our favorite experience. Finally, the guide books warned about theft and recommend not locking the car; however, we did not have any problems in this regard. Most locals were friendly and helpful. Also be aware that the bugs are everywhere and bug spray is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property and friendly staff!!”
Reviews.Author: juicetropics40
Reviews.Content: My stay here was very comfortable. I am usually a difficult person to please, but I was not at all disappointed. The staff is very friendly and â€œZachâ€�, the property dog, is very cute!!

Reviews.Title: “Unplugged”
Reviews.Author: Sarah R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hacienda Tamarindo for four nights. I would describe this as more of a B&B. If you are expecting to find resort type properties on this island, the only one out there is the W. This is a place to unplug from electronics and enjoy the natural beauty of the beaches, crystal clear waters, bio bay and beach bars. It's not really about the hotel, resort, pools, etc... Plan to have a car and travel to the beautiful beaches on this island. The positives about Hacienda Tamarindo: the honor bar was different and gave the hotel a homey feel. Fresh beach towels, cooler, and beach chairs provided in the room was convenient. The bagged lunches that were able to be ordered the night before were good for daily beach trips and were reasonably priced ($8-9.00 daily per person). Pool was kept fairly clean and it was nice to have a place on the property to hang out if you didn't want to be at the beach. Blue Horizon is literally in the back yard of this property and was within walking distance for dinner or to go to the bar there. This property was a good distance from the noise of the Malecon but close enough that it didn't take long to get to downtown or to visit the more popular beaches. Negatives: Probably my biggest complaint would be that the bed was two twin mattresses put together with a foam pad on top to join them together so they looked like a king sized bed. The sheets, mattress pad and bed covers were old/outdated. The sheets did not fit the mattress and had lost elasticity so the sheets popped off during the night every night and you ended up sleeping on the foam pad - ICK! The bed was comfortable enough but I thought that the least they could do would be to provide decent bed coverings. The pool area had lounge chairs but they were so outdated that the oxidation from the chairs ended up on your body if you sat in them. The rooms were in dire need of an update - walls and ceilings needed painting and you just never felt like the bathroom was clean. At night we saw mice scampering around in the honor bar area. At first we thought they were geckos, but they were mice. Though the property had some nice plantings around the pool area, it was otherwise without landscaping. It could use a path from the house to the pool. We did have missing money but did not have any proof so we didn't mention it. Now that I see that others had the same experience, I'm guessing that staff took ours as well. The breakfast in the morning was good but we found the staff there to be unfriendly and cold. Overall we enjoyed our time on the island and enjoyed the relaxed feel. I agree that a room safe would add to the comfort of this property. No one wants to have to go to the office and bother someone to get their belongings and be confined to access during business hours. Quality bedding would also be a huge plus.

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_Sch
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for a few nights and enjoyed our stay. It's expensive. Our 2 room suite (a king bed, and 2 singles) was $270 + $35 per kid extra, plus a mandatory 10% service fee, plus PR taxes. By the time we finished everything, it was close to $400 per night for a room with no view, which compares to a nice hotel in any major US city. The location is out of town, so you will be dependent on your car for almost everything. While we were there, two guests (that we know of, maybe there were more) had money stolen out of their locked rooms; we didn't have an issue. Theft out of cars is a huge problem in Vieques, and we passed about a dozen cars in our travels that had windows smashed out (we had no problems). People refers to bricks as the "Vieques Master Car Key", and it seems like theft from tourists is not viewed as a problem since it affects tourists mostly. Honestly, I found it stressful constantly worrying about theft from my locked car and my locked room. Breakfast was nice, as you would expect. The view is superb, and the pool is pretty and infrequently used. Bring bug spray if you intend to spend time at the pool at dusk. Vieques is beautiful and it's great place to find undiscovered beaches that look like they were plucked from a "best beaches of the world" book. One note...everybody that we met on Vieques speaks English, and there really isn't a cultural component to Vieques. Everyone we met (with the exception of Abe) was from the USA. I was hoping to expose my kids to another culture, but it really felt like being in the US, at least culturally. We did Esperanza Riding Company one evening, which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We did a snorkeling tour through Abe's, which was the highlight of our trip as we did the adventurous tour and saw some beaches that we way off the beaten path. Suggestion: The place could use a safe deposit box in each room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay on our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: hmpmcp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hac Tam for 3 nights (10/31-11/3) at the beginning of our honeymoon. It was wonderful! We stayed in a Carribean Deluxe room (can't remember number, but I'm pretty sure it is the one pictured in the virtual tour on their website.) The views from the balcony were gorgeous. While we didn't spend too much time out there, I appreciated having an outdoor space with my room. The room itself was great, plenty of room, double vanities and comfy bed. We did use the A/C at various times, which worked very well. Breakfast was nice, as well as the option for a packed lunch. We did utilize this one day for the beach and it was super convenient. The honor bar is also nice to have available. Having beach chairs, towels and a cooler for the beach in the room was also a huge plus. It was so easy just to hop in the car and start exploring the island. Our reservation included a car rental from Maritza's, so we didn't have to worry about setting that up. This was our first trip to Vieques, and after seeing the island, I felt the location in Esparanza was a good choice. There are several restaurants and bars on the main strip in town, which was just a few minutes in the car. We drove through Isabel Segunda one day, and didn't care for the "bustling" atmosphere. Also, Esperanza's side of the island (Carribean) has the majority of beaches where you will spend your time, with several only 5-10 minutes from the hotel. Due to the time of year, a few restaurants we attempted to make reservations at were closed. However, it was no big deal, as there was still many options available. The plus of visiting during the off season is the likelihood of being one of only a few people, or the only ones on a beach! I thought this was amazing and something I had never experienced before. The discounted rates at this time of year are also a definite plus. The staff was great, very nice and informative. Received good advice regarding tours and restaurants. (Loved Next Course and Duffy's for food, and Vieques Adventure Company's clear canoes for Biobay tour.) We booked the room only about 2 weeks before traveling, and making the reservation via email was a breeze. Our only regret was not staying longer. The remainder of our trip was spent on mainland Puerto Rico, which we also enjoyed...but Vieques definitely stood out as our favorite destination. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Amber W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got married in Vieques, and had an amazing time at the Hacienda. It's a beautiful location and the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Hands down, I'd recommend this beautiful hotel to anyone traveling to the island.

Reviews.Title: “FUNTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Rod W
Reviews.Content: This is one of the finest places we have ever stayed. Helpful people and fantastic location. Don't miss the breakfast and say Hi to Zack (the resident pet) when you go. You will not regret a stay at this Vieques paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Msjcosta
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, nice pool with great ocean view, good hearty breakfast and great packed lunches for a nice sunny day at the beach. It was quiet, we had a very relaxed vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A true Island Experience”
Reviews.Author: JMalave23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a 10 day trip around PR. We stood in Vieques for one night. We later regretted it. Without a doubt we need to come back and spend at least 3 days. The hotel is a little on the pricey side but very well worth it. Great view. Great service. You are welcomed in with open arms and are given a mini crash course on services available to you as well as recommendations for places to eat and attractions to visit. There is a self serve wine bar and recreational type room after hours (you are given the key to access during check in). The hotel trusts you to accurately track what you have taken from the bar by logging it in a journal near the bar, your room will be charged accordingly. My husband and I had a room near the bar with a view of the pool. The room across from us had it's own private balcony. Do be advised the the rooms are not equipped with a TV. You really get the full experience of being out in the wilderness and removed from urban civilization. One really creative touch that each hotel room had are journals for all visitors to submit an entry and not only share their experience in La Hacienda but also their experience in general on the Island of Vieques. I spent one night reading two journals in our room (who needs a TV when you have these journals!!). Your stay includes a complimentary breakfast served on the top floor of the hotel - restaurant style. You are also able to place an order for a "bag of lunch" to take with you on the road. I can't recall if this was included. I think this is an additional charge but its a service that is well worth taking advantage of if you have a jam packed itinerary for the day. Although we were there as a newly wed couple that doesn't necessarily mean that this place is limited to couples. There was a family of four that stood in La Hacienda while we were there. This place can accommodate couples and families. We definitely plan on coming back to Vieques and La Hacienda Tamarindo.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Wedding & Stay at Hacienda Tamarindo!”
Reviews.Author: carriealexis
Reviews.Content: We had the luxury of having our wedding at Hacienda Tamarindo, since we were able to fill it up with our friends and family. It is such a special place, with such charm. The views are amazing, the breakfast delicious and each room has its own unique touch. We especially appreciate the hospitality and Burr & Linda for putting up with our late nights and partying. Joey was such a big help as well. Unfortunately it rained most of the time we were there, but the rain brought us all closer together! We had one of the best nights in the dining room playing Trivial Pursuit with our guests. Luckily, the rain cleared up for our wedding day - and our reception at Hacienda was wonderful. Our wedding planner and her team (Sandy Malone - Weddings In Vieques) did an amazing job decorating Hacienda with simple touches to let the charm shine through. My parents, grandparents and aunt and uncle loved the Casita - which was perfect for them so they could be together. Hacienda Tamarindo is a very special place and we cannot wait to go back (on our own - so we can relax)!

Reviews.Title: “You owe it to yourself to stay here”
Reviews.Author: JitneyW
Reviews.Content: This spot is nothing short than incredible. The staff, the grounds, the service... all top notch. The property is in a great location in relation to other attractions on the island and is very reasonably priced. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous laid back vacation destination”
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a full week at the HacTam last January on a recommendation from my brother and his wife who have been to the island several times. Everything was just as we hoped it would be. We prefer a vacation where we are left to ourselves and not overly coddled by insincere hotel staff. The staff at the HacTam was always friendly and helpful if we needed them, but largely invisible otherwise. We can't say enough good things about the breakfasts, the pool (best in PR) or the views. Linda and Burr were great and even invited us up to their home for a small cocktail party one evening. The room was great and view from our deluxe Caribbean made for perfect happy hour viewing. To illustrate how accomodating the staff were: Our last morning there we were due at the airport early, even before breakfast is normally served. The ladies in kitchen saw us leaving and insisted on making us breakfast one last time. Then, as we were about to drive away for the airport we noticed we had a flat tire (the roads are in rough shape on Vieques) and we had not much time left before we were due at to check in at the airport. When we ran back inside to seek help, the breakfast ladies summoned a fellow with an air compressor and sent us on our way. Super people they have working there. If you want room service, fancy restaurants and gift shops this is not for you. If you want a great location, good people, good breakfast, lovely rooms and world class pool this is the place for you. Spend a little more money and get room with a balcony, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and quality driven management”
Reviews.Author: gradyvt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hacienda for our two nights in Vieques, part of a week long trip in Puerto Rico and the Miami area. I have also reviewed other sites during this trip including a nice stay at The Gallery in San Juan. PR's Rough Guide provided the information that led to many of our travel choices this visit. Note that the Hacienda has their own website but doesn't appear to be on the big travel sites. The grounds are clean and attractive with lush but well maintained tropical plantings. A large tamarind tree grows in the lobby and through an opening in the upper floor. The building is open and inviting. The inn has a pool, and though we didn't get time to use it, it was a nice looking amenity. A salon with an 'honor-bar' including top shelf liquors is another good option that we did not get a chance to make use of. We stayed in the Vermont room, a High Standard type. Because it was one of the least expensive options, we were pleasantly surprised to find the lower level room had views to the Caribbean Sea. The space was very clean and relatively large with a king bed and small balcony. The price, for the room alone reasonable for many areas at less than $150 per night (w/o taxes which range from 15-20%, high, across PR), also included a full breakfast. This was not a buffet, but cooked to order plates with sides, fresh fruit, and a variety of juices. The open air, mostly covered dining area is on the upper level. On top of the value and amenities, one of our most positive experiences at Hacienda was with the management and owner . Our check in started with a tour of the facility and room, a great little detail new to us. The day manager we interacted with most was very friendly, arranged for us to take a bioluminescent bay tour, and seemed genuinely interested in us having a good stay. When checking out our rental car battery had died and he jumped it for us right away. For that matter, almost everyone we met there, including the owner who apparently is very involved and lives on site, seemed to put the visitor experience above the bottom line. Negatives? The closest things to issues from our stay were very few. Before arriving they recommended an island car rental company that turned out to be by far our biggest downer. Because the windows along two walls (and the bathroom door) are louvered wood (with a metal screen to keep mosquitos out) the privacy of the rooms is somewhat limited - sound, not visual. This wasn't much of an issue for us, but when background noises are low, you may be able to hear into the lobby and some other rooms. There is noone manning the lobby desk between 5 pm and 8 am. This was not really a problem for us, though when the room hair dryer malfunctioned we had to just do without. We understand the owners are available from their rooms for emergencies. For all of these reasons we enjoyed our short stay and highly recommend the Hacienda to others visiting Esperanza. [Side note, we suggest anyone going to Puerto Rico take a two day (or longer) jaunt out to Vieques. Flying via Cape Air from SJU to VQS is a safe 25 minute prop flight. Once there be sure to hit Blue Beach for swimming and snorkleing too.]

Reviews.Title: “Unique, clean, comfortable, amazing”
Reviews.Author: davetron5000
Reviews.Content: Let's get the easy stuff out of the way: Hacienda Tamarindo is very clean, comfortable, and has friendly and helpful staff. OK, here's what you can't tell easily from their website: The rooms are all unique and creatively decorated; this is not your average hotel by any means. Each room contains a extra stuff you'll need to enjoy Vieques' many beaches and generally have a good time on the islant. The included (hot) breakfast is REALLY good; you aren't getting an English Muffin and coffee; they have a full-on breakfast with eggs, bacon, etc. The pool is quite sizable and provides a great spot for relaxing. The views from the hotel are gorgeous. While Hacienda Tamarindo is reasonably close to the "main drag" of Eseperanza, it's still fairly secluded, so you won't get a lot of late-night partier noise or other bustle. That said, it's a bit of a hike to walk into the town. But you don't need to do that; just grab your beach chairs and drive to one of Vieques' many secluded beaches. Finally, their "honor bar" is top notch. Feel like enjoying a Ron Barrilito and coke? Not a problem. Just want a beer? They have you covered. Really great bonus feature. Also, the place is VERY reasonably priced. I would definitely stay here again AND recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Casita Linda was just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: brandicj
Reviews.Content: Gracious staff, responsive to requests, beautiful grounds and views, tasty breakfast all in a well appointed but relaxed atmosphere. Much fancier and the hotel wouldn't "fit" with the rest of the island. The Hacienda is set up so that it's ok to come in with muddy feet from the beach or walk up for coffee in your loungewear. The front desk stayed open a little late waiting on us to arrive when our plane was late. Our few tiny maintenance issues were resolved quickly with a smile and an apology. The bar is well stocked. We found lime and mango for drinks right in the trees around the pool. I'm sure there was more to the experienced eye. Breathtaking views. Casita Linda is in a separate building with an adjoining suite that has a separate entrance. The casita has its own driveway, an outdoor dining area, covered veranda with chairs and views of Esperanza, living room with pullout sofa bed, dining for 2 in the full kitchen, games, books, tv with satellite and DVD player (which we never used), bath with a large tiled shower (no bath tub) and 2 bedrooms each with A/C, armoire, and king sized beds. Tile and fixtures as well as ceiling fans throughout looked new with the exception of the shower itself, which though a bit worn was in good working order. Windows throughout are louvered and screened. We did have mosquitos in the room almost everyday, but you quickly learn to wear mosquito repellant at all times on the island. Once we asked, Raid was provided for the room and the problem was resolved. One note - children under 8 are not allowed. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “So delighful”
Reviews.Author: Exploradora11
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was wonderful - from the tasty breakfast, to the comfortable and well-appointed room. We got upgraded to huge suite since it was not a busy time. We really loved how the hotel provided beach chairs and coolers so that when we took off exploring each day, we had everything we needed. It was a great trip, and we'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “The only place in the world we keep going back to”
Reviews.Author: Lamaestra2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were grateful when our friends encouraged us to stay at the Hacienda Tamarindo in Vieques. It was our first trip to the Caribbean, and needless to say, we were ruined for everything else. There is breakfast in the morning on the patio with the breeze gently floating around. Good coffee and food. A lazy newspaper that might be a few days past printing, but really, who cares? The swimming pool is truly remarkable. You float in the cool water while surrounded by incredibly lush trees and overlook the blue sea. I always try to capture it with a photo, but I don't think it can be done. The rooms feel comfortable, special, and inviting. A place that makes me happy to be in bed early. My husband and I have returned to this jewel not only because it fits us so perfectly, but because it's so easy to get to for a quick weekend away. We've been here twice, and sent the parents here as a retirement gift. We've recommended it to everyone that looks for a good vacation. I know we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: peter_oscarsson
Reviews.Content: We stayed eight nights and had a fantastic time. The hacienda has a wonderful location, the rooms are very nice and the staff is super. And they gave us fantastic lunch boxes every day. If I ever return to Vieques, I sure will stay at Hacienda Tamarindo.

Reviews.Title: “Best view and atmosphere on the island”
Reviews.Author: cherylb83
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, but this Hacienda is unforgettable! The view is amazing - the wild horses in the meadow below and the beach beyond is picture-perfect. Our room was well-kept, and the staff was very accomodating. Breakfast is included, and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “A Private Oasis!”
Reviews.Author: donnawittrig
Reviews.Content: Receiving the welcome tour from Joey was priceless. He introduced us to the library, breakfast area, the dog, the pool, the horses and the honor bar. Yep, you make your drink and write it down on a book to be charged upon check out. The included breakfast was wonderful. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “More stressful than relaxing”
Reviews.Author: cantakavita
Reviews.Content: We booked a Caribbean Deluxe room, which is a bit offset from the main property. I'm not sure if it's not as well maintained, but the entrance felt rustic and I had a foreboding feeling as we apparoached the door. There must have been 30-40 mosquitoes in the room. I killed 10 in the first 5 minutes we were there and there were still plenty flying around (not to mention spiders and regular flies). I'm very well traveled in the tropics, and I understand that part of the beauty on a place like Vieques is that it is a wild island, so naturally some bugs, lizards, etc. might enter a property or room. That said, for $200 a night, you would expect the insides of the rooms to be mostly bug-free. The decor and sheets were dated and not appealing at all. Luckily, we were moved to a 2-room suite in the main building, which was just behind the kitchen. The main room was beautiful and largely bug free - large ceilings, lots of light, great bedsheets, but we were only there for 36 hours and had already lost time and energy moving things around. The second room in the suite, where you enter, was dark and dingy - glad we were not sleeping there and didn't have to spend any time in there. The breakfast was below average, nothing to justify the price. The facility itself was OK - it could have been even nicer but is not kept up well (sort of like most things on the island). The pool and the view are quite nice - probably the nicest things about this property - though the chairs next to them are dirty and not relaxing to sit on. We met the owner the day before we checked out, and we asked him if we could check out early since we were leaving the next morning at 8AM. He seemed peeved that he had to come downstairs from his penthouse lair, and then said he wished we had sorted things out earlier if we knew in advance we were going to be leaving early!? (Someone works at the front desk for a limited number of hours each day, and outside that time the owners have to deal with issues). We felt like we were being reprimanded by our boss, instead of being made to feel comfortable on our vacation... he complained that the computers were off and he "didn't feel like turning them on again"... It seemed to us that the owners have moved here for their retirement but don't actually want to be bothered by the task of running a guesthouse. In comparison, the lady at the front desk who moved us into the cleaner room was lovely and helpful. The island of Vieques is on the one hand beautiful, but on the other hand can be stressful (especially if you're only there for a few days) because there is still little infrastructure on the island, and things and people move at a slow pace. This was our second time to Vieques and since we were only there for 2 days, we would have been better off staying at a relaxing hotel instead of a "do-it-yourself", no-frills place. We have heard good things about Inn at the Blue Horizon where we went for dinner one night (overpriced, but nice view and good service) - I would stay there or at the W next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: sfrazer11
Reviews.Content: The Hacienda Tamarindo seems to fit perfectly with the relaxing and beautiful Vieques atmosphere. We stayed in a Caribbean room on the first floor for four nights. The room wasn't fancy, but spacious and bright and had everything we needed. The one complaint we had was that the bed was really hard and not very comfortable.The cooler, beach chairs and beach towels were very handy, as was the honor bar. The views and outdoor areas are absolutely gorgeous! There are plenty of places all over the grounds to hang out- either in privacy or to socialize. We enjoyed the pool on a day too cloudy to go to the beaches. The staff at the Hacienda are excellent, especially Tanya. The breakfasts were delicious every single morning and the lunches packed for the beach were convenient. We thought the Hacienda location was good- close to the malecon in Esperanza, just 10-15 mins to Isabel. We absolutely loved our stay at the Hacienda Tamarindo and would return in a second!

Reviews.Title: “A Really Cool Inn with Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: rlaugh
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hac Tam was great start to finish. It is a unique inn which reflects the locality, but is simultaneously very comfortable. The owners and staff offer great hospitality without being overbearing. The breakfasts and breakfast staff are outstanding. The pool is gorgeous and quiet. Zach the dog is a treat to have around. The honor bar and library are well equipped and super handy. Other reviewers noted that breakfast service goes on right outside some of the rooms and it can be too noisy if you prefer to sleep late. This is true, but we simply brought earplugs and that solved the problem. There also is a tendency for mosquitoes to find their way into the rooms. Based on the location and weather, I don't think there is much that can be done to help this, so plan on bringing or buying some insect repellent. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Minor frustrations but will gladly stay there again and looking forward to going back”
Reviews.Author: xyxoxy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hacienda over a weekend as part of a multi-stop tour around Puerto Rico. When calling to make arrangements I spoke to both Joey and Tonya who were both incredibly helpful in advising us and offering various options. Upon arriving we were given a brief tour of the hotel and then shown our room. The place is beautiful and we loved the room immediately. Everything was meticulously decorated and landscaped telling us that the owners take pride in their hotel. They have also thought of many little extras that other hotels might not consider... things that just make your stay in a far off place that much nicer. They offer a library where you can relax after hours outside of your room. You can borrow a book or use their house computer. There is an honor bar where you can buy drinks and snacks and charge them to your room by writing them down in a book. This is nice if you just want to get out of the room for a bit. My only complaints are minor and are just things that were not made clear to us. The honor bar is closed and locked after hours. After an evening excursion to the Bio-Bay we were looking forward to coming back and having a nice drink before bed... only to find it locked up. Rather disappointing and we really weren't in the mood to go back out to the bars. Also when we checked in we were not given the password for the internet access. There is no mention of a password in the room book or anywhere else that I could find. It was only 8:30PM so I called once trying to reach the owners upstairs and also tried the intercom. No one answered either time. Not an emergency to be without internet access on vacation... but again, a bit of a disappointment that could easily have been avoided. Frankly I don't understand the need for such high security in their remote location but I assume there must be a reason for it. I should also say that the bed was very uncomfortable... the worst in all 4 places we stayed in Puerto Rico. But we did request two beds and 2 twins were the only option available. I suspect their larger beds MUST be better? Service at the hotel is WAY above average. Tonya did everything she could to make us feel welcome and also directed us to several great restaurants (Loved Bananas!). She also helped us book our Bio-bay tour and was very helpful in finding us a car rental when we didn't know to plan far enough in advance. The restaurant staff is also friendly and professional... and of course the breakfast is just delicious. We did not take advantage of the packed lunches but we saw a few and they looked very tasty. Now that we know those little secrets... the next stay will be even better. I can't wait to go back for more than 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “A very well-run, pleasant resort”
Reviews.Author: 51862Dvh
Reviews.Content: A very well-run, pleasant resort: very good breakfasts, well-located to Esperanza where there are some good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “This place gets my vote!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug8277
Reviews.Content: Hands down, this is the place to stay on Vieques. Gorgeous views of the Caribbean, a few minutes drive into Esperanza, and the most accommodating staff imaginable... you cannot ask for more -- everything has been thought about in advance! We booked a last minute trip to Vieques and found Hacienda Tamarindo on TripAdvisor. We took the only room they had available -- Casita Linda, which is actually a house. Burr and Linda at HT have thought of everything. From pre-packed picnic lunches for days at the beach, to a library for an extra beach read, and fortunately in our case, EXTRA GASOLINE for when the ferry crashed and no gasoline could be found on the island! It was just out of town, so a very quiet place to stay. The daily breakfast was scrumptious and the service excellent. We drove all over the island, and didn't see anything that came close. The Inn on Blue Horizon was the closest, and we found it to be very run down. This is where you want to be!

Reviews.Title: “Superb and Memorable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dwag64
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from the Island of Vieques, Puerto Rico. Again we stayed at the beautiful, restful, gem of a hotel, Hacienda Tamarindo (HT). We have visited many islands of the Caribbean, and we can name few hotels which compare with the ambience, comfort, convenience and friendly service of HT. One truly feels "part of the Island", and in no way is there any feeling of being part of a cookie-cutter chain hotel which could be anywhere in the world with a warm climate. It is easy to become friendly with other guests of all ages, and this adds to the enjoyment. The staff could not be more helpful and informative. It is a remarbable establishment and deserves every accolade that it receives.

Reviews.Title: “Truly, a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: efiredaddy
Reviews.Content: We booked our visit after hearing about this secluded little gem from a couple we met when out to dinner one night. I Had to see for myself how beautiful this place was and let me tell you, I was blown away at first from the amazing views just outside our room, then again by the friendly service and cleanliness of the hotel and grounds. The little touches have not been forgotten either as in many larger hotels. I especially love the freshly picked local fruit that comes with each breakfast made to order. The island is amazing from the number one bio bay in the world to the snorkling and each beach on the island is more beautiful than the next. We enjoyed horse back riding through the jungle and out onto the beach, this place just got better each day . The owners of the hotel Burr and linda were top notch. Burr with his friendly humor and linda just emitts class from every pore. I would love to keep this secret to myself but then that just wouldn't be fair. Everyone should enjoy this wonderful find. Eric

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pcalderin
Reviews.Content: Great and cozy hotel with excellent service and food. This hotel is in the municipality island of Puerto Rico (USA) near crystal clear beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, views, people”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMan09
Reviews.Content: A very pretty and comfortable hotel, close to Esperanza (one of the two towns), fantastic pool (see photo) and a charming breakfast everyday in a cute little dining room. The owners and a staff member named Joey are very accommodating, very easygoing. And the owners have a great dog that kind of just ambles around the property. They provided beach chairs, towels and a cooler, so that was nice, too. I wouldnâ€™t have wanted a room off the dining area, however, since it might have been noisy. Only one real downside for us, which is that the bed and the pillows (in the â€œVermont Roomâ€�) were incredibly uncomfortable. Still, we were incredibly happy with our decision to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views, Great Pool, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: jlteacher
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Tamarindo is a great hotel for people interested in spending leisurely days on the beach or by the pool. They have beach chairs and towels and even coolers in the rooms, and the pool is gorgeous. The staff is helpful and knowledgeable, and the breakfasts are delicious. The bed was okay but not amazing, and the rooms were spacious but not luxurious. I would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “One of our best vacations ever!!”
Reviews.Author: ckiefer07
Reviews.Content: We went to Vieques with an extended family (two families- (3 adults, 4 teenagers age 12-18). Don't know that we've ever had a better time than on Vieques, and have only wonderful things to say about the Hacienda Tamarindo, the facilities, and those who worked there. And that doesn't include all of the wonderful breakfasts we had with Rosita (the Hacienda parrot) and Zach, the incredibly friendly and cool sheep dog. A vacation we and our kids will never forget. Highly recommend the Island Adventure biobay tour. I have to think the pontoon boat is better than the kayaks. Go for it!!!! We also did a ton of snorkeling while on the island. We kayaked over to and snorkeled at the island across from the downtown esparanza area. Great time! Also highly recommend making a drive to Green Beach on eastern tip of island - we stumbled on to a giant sea turtle, a wonderful reef for snorkeling - all kinds of fish, and even had a very cool encounter with a 3+' barracuda. Kind of stepping outside our safety zone, but we were never afraid and will never forget the experience. You'll also need to drive east and check out Blue Beach (absolutely beautiful). Make sure you take lots of insect spray - the skeeters will eat you alive. Ran into a Ray at Blue Beach. One in our party hired a fishing guide and had a blast wade fishing for bonefish (caught the biggest of his life). Saw a few sharks and a manattee while fishing as well. Also, quick caution on renting cars on Vieques, even those the good folks at the Hacienda recommend. I read that rentals were risky on Vieques, so I got anal about the reservations and made them way in advance. Then, called tthree times the weeks leading up to our trip (iincluding the day before) and received confirmation every time that our car was ready. I was nervous that they would not give me a reservation number, but since they read my name each time, I felt okay about. Once there, the chumps had no records at all of me ever calling. A HUGE thank you to the manager of the Hacienda for helping us out!!!!!! If you go to Vieques, don't expect a 5 star hotel or treatment from anyone. Great food in Esparanza!! Be ready for a family adventure and cherish every minute of it (good and bad). Iit's something I know our kids will be talking about 30 years from now.

Reviews.Title: “Second trip even better”
Reviews.Author: seamax
Reviews.Content: A few years ago we stayed at the Tamarindo for our anniversary and were charmed by the place. So this year we decided to go back. Some things you can't do twice as it is never as you remembered it but not here. It was every bit as wonderful as we remembered it.Everyone is so nice and helpful. The grounds are beautiful and the pool. Well it's world class, I love it. Of course the breakfasts are terrific but better yet is the lunch they packed for us to take to the beach. My only regret is that they don't serve dinner. We will be back, hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CalWanderers
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, and because of the tropic breezes, we never had to turn on the air conditioner. The breakfast was delicious. The pool and hammocks were great for relaxing. We wish we could have stayed there longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on Vieques”
Reviews.Author: jhughe01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hacienda Tamarindo for one night in June 2010. The rooms were very nice- spacious with comfortable beds, a deck, bathroom with lots of counter space. Other amenities include a nice pool, library with communal computer/internet access, an honor bar. The honor bar was basically a stockpile of beer, wine, various liqours, sodas, etc where you serve yourself and write down what you take. It's so convenient and the prices are very reasonable. With each night you stay at the hotel a free breakfast is included with the price of the room. The breakfast is delicious and consisted of various choices of eggs, breakfast meats, fresh fruit, fruit juices, coffee, etc. The hotel is located right next to one of the companies that does the bioluminescent bay tours (island adventures i think) which was super convenient for us. The owner Burr is so nice and goes out of his way to make sure you are happy with your stay. We had actually planned to stay a second night at the hotel but realized our flight back to states was at 6 AM from San Juan the next morning so we had to get to San Juan that night. We realized this at like 5 PM, way after the time we should have been checking out of the hotel. Burr would have had every right to be irritated by this, but instead he was so nice and drove us to the vieques airport himself and made sure the flight that he set up for us himself did not leave before we got there. It was above and beyond the call of duty. Overall, it's a great place to stay and I definitely plan on staying there again the next time I visit Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent B&B and so much more!!”
Reviews.Author: JAHatcher
Reviews.Content: When we first set foot on the property, it was like stepping in to a little piece of paradise. We had a suite which was very roomy, with a king-size bed. The shutters were open and there was a wonderful breeze coming in off of the water. The room was nicely decorated, and we felt right at home. The location was close to restaurants and shops on that side of the island. Joey (front desk) is extremely personable, and showed us all around the facility and our rooms. The layout is open and airy, and there are ocean views from many areas of the grounds. Mornings are the best there--they have a full breakfast menu, and staff who prepares your meal to order. They have a large library (where we spent an evening playing cards), and after we checked out, we headed out for the beach. Joey provided towels, stored our luggage, and told us that we were welcome to use the lobby restroom and shower upon our return. I would HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone! We thoroughly enjoyed our time there!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect quiet getaway with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: NorthCoastTravelers
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Tamarindo is a great way to pamper yourself, while enjoying the daily adventure of exploring the fabulous Vieques beaches. The room is very comfortable with a great view of the water from a hilltop location. Soft caribbean breezes contribute to a very restful sleep. We enjoyed beginning each day with a gourmet breakfast. The staff provided a nice box lunch to take to the beach, along with a cooler for drinks, folding chairs, and beach towels. All we needed to do was add a rental vehicle, which the Hacienda arranged for us, and we were ready to explore the island. The hotel staff was extremely helpful with advice to help us plan our days. We can't think of a better base from which to visit Vieques. We're already plotting our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Another great vacation at the Hacienda Tamarindo”
Reviews.Author: NHSandman
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay and we have reservations to come back next year. This is really a unique place to stay with wonderful people and a very charming setting. The owners and staff provide a high level of personal attention.

Reviews.Title: “Trup report: February 27 - March 7, 2010”
Reviews.Author: NHSandman
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days at the Hacienda Tamarindo. This was our third visit and we have reservations for next year. This is an ideal spot for a variety of reasons. The setting, furnishings and atmosphere are all delightful, but the best part is the friendliness of the owners and the staff. Burr and Linda Vail are very hospitable and add a lot of personality to the hotel. Jim and Joey are very knowledgeable about the restaurants, beaches and acitivities on the island and go out of their way to be helpful. We arranged our rental car through them and it was waiting for us when we arrived from the airport. Even Zach, the resident dog, is charming. The breakfasts are wonderful and served in a lovely atmosphere by a warm staff. Our favorite restaurant is El Quenepo.In fact, we ate there 3 times. The menu is so varied and there are so many daily specials that we kept going back to try something different. The food is excellent and well presented. Kate is the owner along with her husband who is the chef. She supervises everything in the restaurant and has a very smart and attentive waitstaff. Next on our list is Coconuts, where we ate twice. The atmosphere is fairly basic, but the food is great, the people are friendly, and it is a fun place to eat. We tried Next Course and had a good meal, but they are still getting themselves organized. We ate lunch and dinner at Bravo Beach Hotel where the restaurant has just recently re-opened. The setting is beautiful and food was very good. Lunch at Duffy's was good and it is a fun spot to watch the world go by. I strongly recommend checking the Newsletter "Vieques Events" for activiites. It is available on line at http://www.viequesevents.net or at the Vieques Conservation and Historic Trust in Esperanza, at hotels and various other spots on the island. We found a house tour sponsored by the Trust. It was fascniating to see some of the homes on the island and a lot of people on the tour were residents. The last stop was the W Hotel. It will be very interesting to see how well the hotel does. The setting is beautiful and the design is very sleek. However, there is nothing about it that looks very particular to Vieques or even the Caribbean. The Trust has a regular schedule of interesting events and a small but very nice gift shop on an island without very many shopping opportunities. Our favorite beach is Sun Bay since it is shady and expansive for long walks. We also went to Secret Beach and Navio, which are both good for swimming. Another nice benefit to staying at Hacienda Tamarindo is that they provide beach chairs and packed lunches are available. We would go to the beach every day from about 10 -2 and then head back and relax at the pool for the rest of the afternoon. There is an honor bar so you can enjoy cocktails on the veranda overlooking the water before heading out to dinner. We have been to St. John many times and this island must be like what St. John was 50 years ago. There is not a lot of action which is specifically why we like it: no cruise ships and no casinos. It is nice to vacation in a place where the people are so welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Travelpsychedoc
Reviews.Content: Lived up to my expectations - a delightful place which made our trip on Vieques delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place on a fun island”
Reviews.Author: stegil
Reviews.Content: Relaxed and casual inn. Not fancy but enough to be very nice for the location. Breakfast included and having optional picnic lunches made and beach chairs provided is very convenient for beach hopping. Good location on the island given that a car is needed to get anywhere. On hill with great views above the landscape leading to the ocean (no direct beach access). Only negative are mosquitoes getting in your room but thatâ€™s an issue on the island not just here. Doors are screened, just be sure the close them fast!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel and island”
Reviews.Author: Edjan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel- Hacienda Tamarindo is a small, upscale bed/breakfast hotel. It is 5 minutes outside of Esperanza, the main south coast beachside "town" (restaurants, bars, and minimal shopping-nothing on the island to bring back) off a main road. We had Room 22, the carribean deluxe room on the second floor, with a 6 by 4 balcony. It has a beautiful view of a large pasture (often with grazing horses, which are everywhere on the island) going down to the ocean (1/4 mile away) overlooking the bay and ocean. With the balcony louvered doors open (all the room's doors and windows are screened and louvered, including the access door, bathroom door, and balcony doors) you can lie in bed and watch the morning sunrise unfold, and watch the sunset from the balcony (telephone poles and wires notwithstanding). There is a room ceiling fan (ours was noisy because it was unbalanced), and top of the wall air ocnditioner, with a neat remote control, that works very well. Nice closet, bedside tables, armchairs, comfortable bed, modest bathroom/adequate shower- we really liked the room and it was perfect for our needs. There's a very nice large swimming pool. For each unit, the hotel provides beach chairs, a cooler for the beach, and better excellent quality beach towels daily. The made-to-order breakfasts, in an open air patio 50 feet from our room on the second floor, are generous and served 8-10 a.m. They offer box lunches, which we didn't try, but heard are good. There are two good ice machines (ice for cooler), an air-conditioned library with a computer and wi-fi internet access, a resident cockatoo who hangs around wherever it suits him during the day, a resident large friendly dog (looked like a labradoodle) and best of all, friendly and helpful personnel. They made a reservation for us with Maritza rent-a-car before we arrived ($50 a day for a nice little Suzuki SX4 hardtop, almost new, one of several in the parking lot when we got there). Maritza requires that you take a publico (van) from the airport to its offices (5-10 minute ride, $5 per person) to pick up the car, but they give you a ride to the airport when you return it. Tamarindo also made restaurant reservations, luminescent bay reservations, etc. The Island - We came through San Juan Int. airport and flew U.S. Air, that connected at an adjacent ticket desk/gate with Cape Air. Very convenient, but SUBSTANTIALLY more expensive than if we took a publico to another local airport that had air service to Vieques (friends who stayed a few days in San Juan took that option to go to Vieques). You can't buy duty free for the flight from San Juan to Vieques, but we bought at duty free price, a good bottle of gin at the large nicely stocked supermarket up outside of Isabel (near the only two gas stations on the island-there is a sister supermarket in downtown Isabel as well). We also bought drinks, snacks, etc. there. We found two restaurants to be comparable in quality (high) and price (high) to good mainland restaurants. El Quenipo is a consensus best, but Next Course is very close to it in quality (and price). The rest of our eating places had good pub food (Bili and Duffy's in Esperanza) and up and coming Conuco in Isabel (mostly Puerto Rican fare, too much fried, only open some days). Also in Isabel, Coconuts has good food, but great homemade ice cream, that we'd go to just for dessert. Beaches- We prefer a little shade, so we liked Blue Beach, Media Luna, and Secret Beach, which have some spots with trees a few yards up from the sand, although there are prickly burrs on the ground, so some might find they need to wear beach shoes until they reach the full sand on the beach. Blue Beach has a very shallow drop-off so you can walk out waist high for 50 yards and snorkel to an island a couple of hundred yards off shore in water that you can stand up in most of the way out there. We saw some fish near that island, and two rays, one about 6 ft wide. Blue, and several other beaches are accessed by turning off the main paved road and going through the entrance to the nature preserve and driving down a wide dirt road (there are signs). all of the beaches are great though, and not crowded. What Else- We went to Luminescent Bay, using one of the services that provides two person kayaks, $30/person cash.
