You do have to slather yourself first with an oily rmosquito repellant (guide provided) but it is worth the experience to swim, outlined by a body clinging glow in the water from millions of micro-organisms that light up upon any slight pressure on their cell walls- we also watched as smimming fish caused glowing lines in the water. Vieques is an hour later than E.S.T., so sunrise is later , as is sunset. There are "no-seeums", miniscule bugs that make itchy bites at the beach late in the day as it cools, but the bites go away in a day. The people are friendly, and we felt very safe, even at night, wherever we went. However, you will be warned repeatedly about property theft and not to leave anything valuable in your car, especially at the beaches, and to leave the car unlocked, so that the thieves don't damage the car looking for things to steal. On balance, it is still a great little relatively undeveloped island, no big resort (a W is still threatening to open, but has had repeated delays), and relaxation is its best asset

Reviews.Title: “Service and beauty!!”
Reviews.Author: lazer155
Reviews.Content: Everything that could be done to service travelers- packed lunches for beach exploration, beautiful rooms, grounds and pool. Friendly attentive staff. Very laid back and comfortable. Felt like staying in someone's (very luxurious) home. We had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found.”
Reviews.Author: dkadIowa
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Tamarindo met and exceeded most of our expectations. Our only regret was that we were only there for 3 nights! The grounds were lovely, well-kept and quiet. We stayed in the Caribbean Deluxe villa that was steps down from the pool. The room was clean, spacious, and had a spectacular view from the private patio. Unfortunately we were there shortly after some rainy weather the mosquitoes were bothersome. The staff were VERY friendly and accommodating and provided us with some bug spray for our room. The mattress was a bit too firm for our liking, but this was a small price to pay for the beauty/tranquility of the Inn. The amenities were plenty---from the made-to-order breakfast to the beach chairs/towels and bagged lunches. The hotel sits right next door to the Island Adventures Bio luminescent Bay tours building, which was very convenient. The beaches were fantastic! We found them to be secluded, quiet and peaceful. You must rent a jeep to stay on this island as there is much to explore---which we hope to do more of when we return!

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Could Delight You or Disappoint You Depending on Your Expectations”
Reviews.Author: snowshoedude
Reviews.Content: Should you stay at the Hacienda? It depends on what your expectations and tastes are and how picky you tend to be. It is undoubtedly one of the best options on the island. But here are some considerations: - The bed in our room was very firm (Sealy #1 Firm label to be precise). If you like a firm mattress, then the Hacienda has one or more of them. None of the guests we talked to had soft mattresses in their rooms and indicated their beds where firm. So depending on what kind of bed you are used to, you could find the beds here comfortable firm or uncomfortably hard. Note that the pillows in our room were also very firm as well. - If you book a room that is on the same level as the breakfast area, you could hear noise in the morning coming from diners because the area is right outside at least 6 or 7 rooms (with louvered doors and windows). If you like to get up early, this will not matter. If you are a light sleeper and like to sleep in on vacations, you could find this noise an annoyance. If you like more quiet, then ask for a room away from the breakfast area - While the decor of the public areas and rooms has island touches, a fair amount of antiques and objects from Vermont or New England are used to decorate the place. Some people might find this an unusual touch while others might feel it is out of place on a Spanish Virgin Island. - Our room had a couple of chairs, a dresser, and a couple of nightstands and was relatively spacious with a ceiling fan and very good air conditioning. The room's french doors opening to a good view but no balcony to step out on or sit on.There appeared to be a few rooms that had their own outdoor seating areas although they were semi-private - While a bar of soap and liquid soap is provided by the sink in your room, a dispenser of shampoo and soap is mounted in the shower. Generally the water pressure was good and the shower effective at removing sand. We had plenty of hot water. However, on 2 mornings we lost all water pressure and could not get any water in the room. We went downstairs and found that the water hose used to rinse of feet and chairs worked and the restroom off the lobby still had water so we believe it was a problem with the plumbing and not a general water outage. - The breakfasts are good and convenient. You can select from omelettes, scrambled eggs for example with a side like bacon. They also offer a daily special like french toast or pancakes. You also get juice, hash browns (spiced up if you want), and fruit. This is all included in the price of the room. We found this ample and very good compared to other "inns" or "estates" on other islands that give you a white english muffin, white yogurt, weak coffee.....So if you value a decent convenient breakfast, this place has it. If you want a big buffet, you won't get that here - If you enjoy animals, then you will enjoy the company of the Inn's Old English Sheepdog (shaved to keep cool) and Parrot. At times they hang out in the public areas. If you don't like animals walking around, then you might not appreciate these animals (we liked them both) - The owners did not go out of their way to interact with guests. We did not care about this and not sure whether that is typical of them. But if you like to develop a connection with your innkeepers while staying at inns like this, then you might not find the owners as available as at other inns or "estates" where you have stayed. For those who have not liked inns where the owners were omnipresent, then this place might work for you. You can always contact the owners by calling them or using a house phone if you really want to meet them.. - Great location on top of hill right outside Esperanza so close to restaurants and bars. HOWEVER note that if you are going to Vieques, we'd strongly recommend renting a JEEP. If you can't do this, you should be very good at hitchiking (not recommended) or like renting and riding a bike in high temps on bumpy dusty roads. A JEEP is the best way to enjoy your vacation on Vieques and will allow you to visit the beaches and natural areas easily. We are uber-hikers but would not have wanted to hike to the most remote beaches. The Hacienda will reserve a Jeep for you if you want one. The company they used for us was great and the Jeep had newer aggressive tires which were great on the crazy roads leading to the beautiful secluded beaches. - The hacienda has an honor bar. You won't find a bartender to tip or share your troubles with but for those who like to mix their own, the honor bar is great. - The pool is a simple lap pool, abbreviated size, with a few chaises. It overlooks the pasture and Caribbean and has a nice view. - The hacienda does not have a gym, but when we visited, you could go down the hill the an inn next door and use theirs for a fee. We did not visit the gym so we don't know how it is equipped. - You room will have small ice chest and chairs for the beach and beach towels. An icemaker on the ground floor has free ice so that you can ice down your beverages for the beach. Ice is included in the room cost. The machine always had ice available when we were there. - After fellow guests return to their rooms and shut their doors and louvers, the hacienda is pretty quiet at night except for the sounds of tree frogs and other little creatures outside. We had a couple of mosquitos sneak into the rooms but got them before they got us. Bottom Line: Recommended but consider your personal tastes and expectations. Overall, we liked the Hacienda with the caveat that we found the bed and pillows very firm for our taste and had difficult sleeping because we are used to a softer pillowtop beds we sleep in at home and in our other travels. Guests who like firm sleeping surfaces would have probably enjoyed a good sleep. The problem with the water pressure, while a little inconvenient, was not that big a factor because we were going to the beach anyway. What might be "perfect" to some guests can be less than perfect to others due to differing tastes. But one thing most people will agree on is that Vieques is a great place for nature and beach lovers.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for Vieques”
Reviews.Author: BYarmouthMe
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to imagine a better place to stay while visiting this laid-back, quirky island. The Hacienda is in a wonderful location on the island, just west of Esperanza, and many of its rooms open out to the Caribbean Sea to the south. Many of the guests are repeat visitors and are very friendly. The innkeeper and staff are always helpful, but never in your face. A full, made to order breakfast comes with your room and they'll prepare a delicious box lunch for you (in a back-pack with a cool pack) to take with you on your day's adventures. This is not a place for young children or adults looking for night life. It's quiet and calm. Gorgeous pool and setting.

Reviews.Title: “This is a gem on Vieques”
Reviews.Author: dperel71
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a cozier, smaller but centrally located getaway, this is an excellent hotel. I stayed there 3 years ago and am going back this February. The rooms are great (I stayed in one of the suites and this time round will stay at the Casita). Great views of the ocean, very helpful and pleasant staff...and the breakfasts are delicious (included in the price of the room). Upon arrival, they have a relationship with a Jeep rental business that will pick you up at the airport, bring you their rental lot and send you on your way. It's pretty easy getting around the island and a car is a MUST! The hotel has a great pool and after breakfast, you have the option (at a marginal cost) to get a packed lunch to take with you to the most fabulous, secluded beaches about 15 minutes away from the hotel. Open bar (honor system) when you get back from the beach for some Bacardi and cokes and a swim in the pool. Right next store to Hacienda Tamarindo is the Blue Horizon hotel which is nice to have dinner or cocktails at their beautiful outdoor lounge. Don't miss the bioluminescent bay tour at night (plan it around the full moon for best experience).

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: JackieBayCityWI
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the entire staff at Hacienda Tamarindo for taking such good care of us and making our stay on Vieques so comfortable and relaxing. Starting the day with our made-to-order breakfast made us feel pampered and happy! The staff was always there to answer questions and make recommendations. The accomodations are very comfortable and clean, and the views and grounds amazing. We will certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay on Vieques”
Reviews.Author: Wag109
Reviews.Content: We knew that our evening on the bio-bay would be the highlight of our trip to Puerto Rico but were having difficulty in deciding where to stay on Vieques. Tamarindo was recommended by a friend who had stayed there a few years ago. And he was right on the money. Our resevation e-mail was answered promptly and a few days later, Jim answered all my additional questions in a leisuely phone conversation. He made car rental reservations for us and gave me his take on whether to take the ferry or fly over. (We ended up flying and were glad we did - it was relatively inexpensive and very quick) We arrived early in the day but our room was ready for us - and we were upgraded to a two room suite. By Caribbean standards, the property was plush - well maintained and clean. Jim gave us the tour of the property and then filled us in on the restaurants, shopping and most importantly - the beaches and snorkeling. Blue beach is definitely one of the Caribbean's best and the snorkel spots were exactly as Jim described. The food and the service at breakfast were both great. It was a very comfortable and friendly stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Vieques hotel review”
Reviews.Author: LynnieT2
Reviews.Content: very clean andwell appointed for the remote location. Staff was friendly. Hotel was private. Grounds were nice. Perfect getaway for the traveler who does not want a resort but wants ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, tropical, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: denverroadtrip
Reviews.Content: I really liked my stay here. We stayed in a 1 room suite. It was a large room w/two beds, and a wet bar area. The pool area was beautiful. The pool is too short to swim laps but it's wide, so it feels large. The grounds were pretty and the honor bar was excellent. Jim was a great host and made a great first impression. I wish I could have stayed here longer. My only complaint was the mattress. I think it was a hard industrial foam. I didn't sleep well. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, gorgeous, and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: Derek_L20
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my gf for 2 nights and absolutely loved it. We got a room facing the ocean with a small balcony, and it made the atmosphere incredible with the beautiful views. There is alcohol available downstairs in the fridge, and you just sign for whatever you take. There is also free breakfast in the morning. I definitely recommed this place - it was the best part of my Puerto Rico trip. You will love the beaches in Vieques!

Reviews.Title: “Hacenda Tamarindo & Zac : WONDERFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: elenamonci
Reviews.Content: My husband and i recently returned from a 6 day vacation in vieques (our first time there.) we loved the island... the beaches,and Hacienda Tamarindo. We stayed in room # 5 and it was perfect, with a large private terrace overlooking the pool, the rolling hills, and the ocean. Thereâ€™s nothing like hanging out there at night with a glass of beer and looking at the millions of stars. The room itself was spacious and spotless, with wonderfully thoughtful amenities like beach chairs, beach towels, and a cooler. Breakfast in HT is oustanding , served on the second floor terrace, but coffee and tea are available pretty much all day. Every day thereâ€™s a different special and delicious meal. Joey and Jim at the front desk were terrific. They were extremely knowledgable about the island and gave us wonderful advice. Special thanks to Joey , once again, for having found the flight for my husband. The location is beautiful, the rooms have beautiful views of the ocean and surrounding area and the pool is great, BUT WE FELL IN LOVE WITH ZAC, the resident ever welcoming and gentleman dog. We will definitely go back to vieques, hacienda tamarindo ......Only complaint is that the bed was not very comfortable....you can't have it all. Elena & Maurizio Pasi - Bologna Italy

Reviews.Title: “Laid back charm with ocean view”
Reviews.Author: OHIOFrequentFlyers
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Tamarindo, located near the main tourist area in Vieques, gives you a large comfortable room from which to base your island exploring and the equipment - chairs, towels, laundry, to make it easier to enjoy one of the many gorgeous and secluded beaches. Or enjoy a comforable chair, a good book, a cold gin and tonic from the honor bar, and look out to the beautiful blue sea. It has a wonderful breakfast included, with daily specials or order from the menu. The Tamarind Tree in the lobby adds to the charm and romance of the place. The staff will assist you in renting a jeep, finding a restaurant, or directing you to your choice of a beach. Down the road a bit is Island Adventures whose talented young staff will take you out to the biobay at night, for a dip in the phosphorescent waters, and idenetify the constellations of the night sky as well. There's a good Mexican restaurant there too. Vieques has a number of fine places to eat, mostly in the more tourist-y area but we also very much enjoyed El Patio in Isabel Segunda. Hacienda Tamardindo has internet, but I wouldn't call it "high speed." It's very much of the old modem connection type. Some reviews have questioned insect presence in some hotels in Puerto Rico or the tropics. We didn't see any in April, but there was a can of Raid in the room. We look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Real Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Wernero
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hacienda Tamarindo for 3 nights (next time min. 7 nights!). It's a beautiful small hotel, with nice and comfortable "Caribbean" rooms, perfect settings, wonderful breakfasts and a very friendly and helpful staff. We enjoyed not only our short stay in this Hacienda, but also all the beautiful sceneries and beaches of the Isle of Vieques. We will certainly come back for a longer stay. Werner and Eeva from Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Tamarindo is now our casa on Vieques”
Reviews.Author: ROThornhill
Reviews.Content: The reason Hacienda Tamarindo is a great stay starts with what a visit to Vieques entails. The island doesn't have a lot of development, which makes it "unspoiled," but can also occasionally make you miss an amenity or two (we would say "deal with it," but that's another story). The nice thing about Hacienda Tamarindo is it adds a little luxury and amenity without losing the casual, easygoing way of Vieques. You won't plan a visit here because of the little touches like the free beach chairs and cooler, and the honor bar, but they will be much appreciated after you get here. The staff was attentive without being in your face, the owner was friendly and helpful (we note some past guests haven't clicked with him, but maybe he's a good judge of character). Did we mention breakfast was great? Lastly, the setting is a paradise and the hotel is eclectically decorated (in a good way). And the pool is a nice place to chill out. No, you can't walk to the beach, but you'll have more fun tooling around the island in your jeep anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Vieques Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Cuse44
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an island wedding in Vieques where we stayed at the Hacienda Tamarindo. We were the only ones from about 65 attendees to stay at this hotel, and we are very glad we did. The room was sizeable and the A/C kept us cool at night. The views and pool are amazing, but the full breakfast each morning put the stay over the top. Beach chairs,coolers, and ice are provided for daily trips to the beaches, which are awesome. Jim, one of the managers was extremely pleasant and helfpul. After seeing some of the other places people stayed, I am glad we spent a little more to stay at the Hacienda. Only complaint is that the bed was not very comfortable....you can't have it all.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and unexspected”
Reviews.Author: elzabeth
Reviews.Content: This review is long over due. My husband and I stayed for 1 week we stayed in 2 different rooms on 1 floor that had ocean view. Both rooms were nice.What I did notice was that all rooms were nice even lower priced were a great buy. [for bugets] The pool was just a breath of fresh air. Pictures don't do property justice.Food was terrific and staff fantastic.We did the bio. bay tour very fun.We loved all the animals. Barkley the dog , cat and shabu the bird.Also we had a car rented, which is a must. Great island to explore. The beaches are fantastic and esperanza at night was fun for music and drinks bar was called Bananas I think. We met lots of nice guest and tried a variety of good resturants from rib's, to sushi. This place is well worth a visit I can't say enough. Kisses to all the wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as Advertised!”
Reviews.Author: JonHadley
Reviews.Content: A charming, small hotel, beautifully designed and furnished in a nineteen-thirties atmosphere, with a beautiful Caribbean view, a perfect pool and a warm library. About a five minute walk brings you to a deserted beach on the Caribbean. This is great for sunning but not for swimming. There are underwater rocks. Vieques is less developed at least partially because large areas are government owned and/or nature preserves. There are no high rises, golf or casinos. A rental car really helps, it is pretty much a necessity. Once you buy into the Vieques style, Hacienda Tamarindo has to be on your short list for hotels. I couldnâ€™t help but think of Hemmingwayâ€™s Islands in the Stream the entire time I was there. You can't go wrong unless your looking for a spring break atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Only Place to Stay in Vieques!!”
Reviews.Author: EastLansingCouple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed the week following Thanksgiving in Room 5 at the Hacienda. Upon arrival, our Jeep had been delivered and the staff gave us a tour. I was instantly struck by how quiet and peaceful the property was. As we looked out over the Caribbean sea with our cocktails from the honor bar, we noticed another guest napping under a palm tree by the pool. I knew then that we had made the right choice. The accommodations were simple but clean and comfortable. It has a bed-and-breakfast feel, but I mostly felt like I was a family friend, not a hotel guest! It was that comfortable, laid back, and welcoming. Our room was definitely one of the better ones - we had a huge patio with lounge chairs and a great view of the Caribbean. We enjoyed breakfast early every morning (my husband loved the Tamarind juice and the spicy potatoes were my favorite). I wish someone would have told us to tip the breakfast ladies - with free breakfast, we were not sure until we saw others doing it and had to "catch up" on our third day. The staff were incredible - owners and employees both. They recommended the best restaurants (El Quenepo was our first dinner - what a way to welcome us to the island!) and helped arrange travel, etc. From speaking to other travelers and driving around the island, I can say without a doubt that when we return to Vieques, we will be staying at the Hacienda.

Reviews.Title: “What a place to unwind and the people are fantasic”
Reviews.Author: Flyeridaho
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hacienda Tamarindo on the 26th of December. While we got in about 6:30 and the office was closed, our keys were waiting for us. It was the start of the most relaxing hotel experience I have had in a long time...Our room overlooked the ocean on one side and the pool and town of Esperanza on the other side. We settled into the room and felt the warm tropical breeze flow through the room from all the windows. The room was clean and large. Lots of sitting places and even luggage racks for both of us. While we both commented that the bedspread comes from the generic hotel bedspread factory the bed itself was great. We liked the little offbeat ammenities like the "Wash Away Your Sins" soap dispenser. The room had a fan to assist in the breeze but who needed it. Did I mention the great honor bar that they have? A real treat at mid-night. The hotel is like a cross between a B&B and a small hotel. The breakfast the next day under the tamrind tree was great. The wait staff where very friendly and fast. At each table they provided an overview of all the world news so you are not completely unplugged. We did not have a rental car, make sure you comfirm before you go, so we walked everywhere. Jim gave use a contact for one of the publicos but we found the walk down to the beach and then into town was one of the best parts of staying here. We truely unwound as we walked along the beach, We could have used the taxi to go to one of the beaches but found that Sun Bay was just a good and the walk was fun too. The staff always had the room clean and tidy when we arrived back to the hotel and were just great to answer any question. Jim was especially helpful in talking about the island, people, and things to do. After three wonderfull nights, the rooms are great, could not hear another soul, and four glorious days we had to check out to catch our flight. As we sat out on the balcony I plugged my cell phone into charge. As we left, I of course forgot about it until we got to the airport. How stupid! Well Sharon (who should be your choice for taxi driver) was going to beat a world round trip record back to the hotel, we called to see if anyone else was coming. To my great surprise they had someone that was coming to the airport. When my phone arrived it was Jim who went out of his way to get my phone to me. He then refused any payment for this superior client service! Carol and I were both amazed and how well they took care of every detail for us. It was an amazing trip and the highlight was our stay at Hacienda Tamarindo!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and peaceful inn with great breakfast & service”
Reviews.Author: pepesone
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Tamarindo was absolutely fantastic from the start. The guy at the reception showed us the premises and our room and how everything worked in HT. This was a warm welcome. We stayed in room (room #1) with patio in a separate building - could not have asked for more. I guess it was Caribbean deluxe. It was peaceful, had great view, magnificent breakfast (made to order, good quality and tasty including daily special!) and they provided lunch boxes for the beach if you wanted - not too expensive. They have an honor bar meaning that you can mix drinks/get beer/water/snack etc. on your own and write it down and they'll add it up to your room check. HT people arrenged a car for us and gave tips about restaurants and beaches! They also provide beach chairs and cooler with ice cubes for each room, which makes it easy to hit the beaches and just relax with cold drinks (we also had fridge in the room)... Pool is good size and does not have salt water. I wanna go back already.

Reviews.Title: “was okay”
Reviews.Author: Zeero
Reviews.Content: First off, this island is more of a one time visit destination. The beaches were beautiful but so are many beaches elsewhere. The island is hot, severly underdeveloped and prices swing either way. Either really good dirt cheap from some guy in a truck or expensively overpriced on any of the restaurants on "main street" in esperenza. That being said, this hotel is one of the best in the area and that's not really saying much... The price is pretty high. And there are only really 2 saving graces. The breakfast and the pool. These 2 are quite possible the best in the island. The ladies that work the breakfast/clean your rooms are quite awesome. I had the room upstairs (they call it a suite). It was never cold and borderlined on being or actually was uncomfortably hot the whole time. This room (27?) seriously needs 2 airconditioners. The first room and the bathroom remains unbearably hot (went in july) and the bedroom barely manages to stay cool because of the other rooms and because of all the windows letting the sunlight in. It's also impossible to sleep late (which should fully be possible during a vacation) because the sunlight directly hits the bed in the morning blinding the hell out of you. At least the room had a fridge which the smaller rooms do not. This room seriously needs curtains. The hotel had tried to charge us a higher rate then what was booked, but was nice about it after I complained. However, i shouldnt have to complain in the first place. The place has no tv. However, with the amount that they charge, they should at least have one in the library if anything. That or splurge and ensure each room has an air conditioner. There's nothing in the hotel that justifies why they charge such high fees. All the towels are generally worn. They do have provide small coolers, umbrellas and chairs which is a definite plus. There's a honor bar the but the prices are are slightly higher than a nearby grocery store and there's a camera anyway though it's highly unlikely it's constantly monitored. If you stay here you definitely need a vehicle. It's not near any beach so you have to drive whenever going out. Else lounge by the pool. The pool is great, clean and has floaties to play with. If you are set on coming to this island, know what you are getting into. The smaller rooms are better because the air conditioner works effectively. The bigger rooms do have a fridge which is always a plus because it's so hot, you are always thirsty. Double check your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Good Breakfast - room 6 needs new bed”
Reviews.Author: LarissaCT
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Hacienda Tamarindo is the breakfast - the menu has everything you would want with different specials every day and friendly wait staff. I wouldn't reccommend the bagged lunches - they were just okay (not worth $7). There were a couple things we did not like or found misleading: The website photos makes it look like Hacienda Tamarindo is right next to the ocean but it's really not - it's about a five minute walk and then it's difficult to get down to the sand (it's really steep and we couldn't find a path). I believe we were in room six and while the room was fine - the bed was horrible - we barely slept the whole time we were there. One more thing- do not rent from Maritza's car rental (see my post on the Vieques Forum). If you're going to have the B&B rent the car for you ask them to use another car rental company.

Reviews.Title: “Truly for the adventure seeker”
Reviews.Author: LuvTravel007
Reviews.Content: Stay overnight on Vieques Island if you are truly an adventure seeker. The locals say Hacienda Tamarindo is the nicest place to stay. My traveling partner was ready to leave as soon as we pulled up to the hotel. It is a bed and breakfast style hotel. There is no TV, no restaurant, wall type cooling unit and self serve bar (which means you help yourself and write down what you take on a notepad). The internet was a computer in the "library". It was so slow it doesn't even count as having internet. The bed was terrible. I do not understand why they do not get the nice beds with pillow tops and expensive linens. It was not cheep to stay here. The hotel needed to be painted. The back side had paint pealing everywhere. There was antiques (which looked like junk to me) and clutter around the property including a mobile home trailer right out the back of the hotel. We made the best of it and it sounds like this is the nicest place to stay on the island according to talking to the locals. If you want to stay on Vieques I'd stay here but just have realistic expectations before you get there. We were kinda shocked. The property could have been sooo charming if the owners would spend a good amount of money on repairs, remodeling and upgrade the furnishings. Also, they need a good housekeeper.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, peaceful perfection!”
Reviews.Author: newlywed80
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an intimate, quiet and romantic hotel with excellent service on Vieques then this is the place!! My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon and we stayed at Hacienda Tamarindo and LOVED it, loved it, loved it. Their website does not do justice to the beauty and charm of the place. Perhaps the best part of this hotel is you hardly notice that anyone else is staying there until you see people trickling in for breakfast. And the staff is so unobtrusive but they are always there if you need something. We felt like we were the only two people there but it was booked! Speaking of good service, they reserved a rental car for us (definitely get one, you'll miss out on so many unbelievable beaches if you don't) and had it delivered to the hotel. Our room was just perfect, beautifully decorated with amazing ocean breezes and views, and a very comfy bed. The breakfasts are excellent (awesome juices and coffee) and the packed lunches are just so convenient when you're out exploring the beaches - and many of them are off the beaten path. At the end of our days we'd enjoy a dip in their beautiful pool overlooking the sea, and a relaxing rock in the hammocks. We really can't say enough about our experience there - I'm telling you, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “A Tropical Gem”
Reviews.Author: travelerNewYork
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights at this amazing place and hated to leave. It is absolutely wonderful with such an eye and attention for detail and guestsâ€™ comfort. We felt more like guests at a private house than guests at a hotel. There is a great little library with cozy chairs and loungers for reading and relaxing, lots of books and magazines, and a computer with free Internet for our use. Outside the library is the honor bar with pretty much everything you could need for a cocktail or a night cap. Wine, beer, and snacks like chips and peanuts are also available. We had room number 5 and it was just perfect, with a large private terrace overlooking the pool, the rolling hills, and the ocean. Thereâ€™s nothing like hanging out there at night with a glass of wine and looking at the millions of stars. The room itself was spacious and spotless, with wonderfully thoughtful amenities like beach chairs, beach towels, and a cooler. The pool is one of the best maintained weâ€™ve ever seen and we travel a lot! There are comfy loungers and a pergola with table and chairs if you want to stay out of the sun. Most mornings we had it to ourselves, which suited us just fine :) Breakfast is on the second floor terrace, but coffee and tea are available pretty much all day. Every day thereâ€™s a different special, from stuffed French toast (with mango jam and cream cheese), to Eggs Benedict, and banana pancakes. Aside from the specials you can have eggs any way you like, with sausage, ham, or bacon. The home fries rock, especially the spicy version!!! The ladies who work the breakfast are wonderful, friendly, kind, and gracious. In fact all the staff is wonderful, kind, and gracious. The best nearby restaurant is El Quenepo in Esperanza. We should have eaten there every night :) The Cuban grill and the â€œOnce around the aquariumâ€� dishes are easily enough for two if you have appetizers. Do the bio bay tour through Island Adventures! Just up the road from hotel and an unforgettable experience. Do not, however, eat at their restaurant lol. It was pretty terrible and it deprived us of the chance to eat at El Q a third time. For the best grilled whole fish youâ€™ll ever have go to Mucho Gusto, (Esperanza) but be sure to check prices for it first. We didnâ€™t and it was a whopping 30 dollars per fish. It was absolutely fantastic fish but wow, what a sticker shock lol. Along with beach hopping and driving around, be sure to spend some time at the Hacienda also. Itâ€™s so peaceful, relaxing, and absolutely perfect. Buy a bottle of wine at the Green Store along with some cheese and crackers, then have your own impromptu cocktail hour before heading out to dinner. And before going to bed, take a dip in the pool (quietly!) and look up at the incredible starry sky above. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!”
Reviews.Author: LookingforGilligan
Reviews.Content: There are more luxurious hotels, but this place was wonderful. The most excellent experience ever. We stayed in room number five, which had it's own, private balcony with lounge chairs and a view of the ocean, the pool and the grounds. The room was lovely as is the entire property. Their breakfasts are excellent, and take them up on their offer to pack you a lunch for the beach. The small touches, providing beach chairs, beach towels, and a cooler, make all the difference. Sun Bay was our favorite beach, but rent a jeep and explore the rest of the Island. You can do it all in one morning. Make the trip to Green Beach just to see it. You really will have it to yourself. Treat yourself and stay at this most wonderful place. The staff are very friendly and helpful, too.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ambermae
Reviews.Content: My husband and I based our Vieques honeymoon at Hacienda Tamarindo and couldn't have asked for a better experience. Our room was large and private and had a great view of the Caribbean Sea. We enjoyed leaving the louvered doors open during the day to enjoy the calm sea breezes. Breakfast was convenient and delicious. The Hacienda felt like home. Everyone we spoke with was very helpful and friendly. Though the place became busy with a wedding party the last few days of our trip, the only real change was that the honor bar outside our room became a bit noisier at night and breakfast took a bit longer. We would love to go back should we ever find ourselves in Vieques again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: CZProvidence
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, nice pool, great breakfast, extensive honor bar. Our room was a little dark, but large and very functional. Lots of amenities like beach towels and rain umbrellas. We stayed here 1 night because we went on a Biobay tour with Island Adenvtures. It's right next door and it was one of the most amazing experiences of our lives. Wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Tamarindo saved our trip!”
Reviews.Author: RyanAndErin
Reviews.Content: We booked our initial stay on Vieques with another hotel. Needless to say, when we actually checked into our un-named $300 a night room, we were floored to find a horribly leaky ceiling and loads of mold, and an unsympathetic staff. So we quickly got online and started calling other hotels to see if they had *any* availability to help us on such short notice. Hacienda Tamarindo was on our list of other possible hotels we almost booked, so we gave them a call while flustered with our current situation. Jim, the front office manager at the time we called Tamarindo, was SO kind and helpful. He had one more room, and gave us directions on how to get there and was extremely kind and patient with two exhausted travelers :) Needless to say, we *loved* our room. We booked the Suite that even though didnt have a direct ocean view, did have a beautiful view of their outstanding pool area, and actually did have a view of the ocean from the sitting area of our suite. The suite and the surrounding property and ground were clean and extremely well kept. Breakfast was phenomenal - every morning you had choice of juices, eggs, fruits, hashbrowns, breads, cereal, and a special of the day, along with an assortment of teas (which we really liked). Coffee too of course. (If you like oatmeal in general, order the Puerto Rican version here...YUM!) While we never ordered a premade lunch, they looked great and came in a nice backpack for easy carrying to and from the beautiful Vieques beaches. The owners and front office staff were always extremely helpful with questions about activities and locations of various beaches. They really went out of there way in helping us, which was such a great help with us not being "in the know" of where the best beaches are! We absolutely loved swimming in the Bio Bay. It was really amazing how much it glowed. A must see activity. The beaches were beautiful. If you are willing to go off the beaten path, you will almost certainly find a strech of beach all for yourself! The main town of Esperanza had a great selction of foods for lunch and dinner. We ate at Duffys (great drinks and food), Trade Winds (lobster and fish were tasty), and Bananas (Americana bar food) and always enjoyed our meals and drink. The only somewhat let down of our stay was the abandoned military bunkers. Not much to see but earth covered storage buildings that you cant go in and explore. If you are going, this is the place to stay. We saw other locations of villas and such that we had looked at, but when we go again it will be straight to Hacienda Tamarindo.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: tomhardy123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went on our honeymoon to Puerto Rico and for part of our honeymoon we stayed at Hacienda Tamarindo for 3 nights and it was the best 3 nights of our honeymoon. Vieques is beautiful and Hacienda Tamarindo is the perfect place to return to after a long day on the beach or a night out.

Reviews.Title: “Dumb Blonde Jokes Delivered with Breakfast?”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorNewHavenCT
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hacienda Tamarindo several times, most recently in March 2008, when I was there with my college age daughter. The excellent view from the pool of this B and B is now partly blocked by a trailer positioned on an adjacent property. The breakfasts are well cooked and substantial. However the owner prints out sheets of misogynist jokes from the internet along with a newspaper summary and delivers these on the table at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Caribbean Tranquillity”
Reviews.Author: Cinghiale
Reviews.Content: Having researched a number of the accommodations listed for Vieques on TripAdvisor, we ultimately settled on the Hacienda Tamarindo for our week-long stay in April 2008. The Hacienda offers warmth, charm, tranquility and a relaxed atmosphere. Our room, on the upper level, had windows on two sides with a small balcony overlooking the ocean. Traditional wooden shutters allowed the gentle breeze from the sea to cool the room at night and obviated use of the A/C. The room and the common premises were immaculate. The open-air breakfast area, in the shade of the tamarind tree for which the guesthouse is named, is as charming in reality as it appears in the photos. Breakfasts were excellent and the restaurant staff were good-natured. Jim and Walmer at the front desk were unfailingly gracious and always had helpful suggestions. As a lifelong swimmer, I enjoyed doing laps in the lovely pool each morning. The pool is just long enough for laps and also impeccably maintained. Most of the beaches also afforded excellent swimming. Rent a jeep to get around the island and visit the lovely beaches as well as nearby Esperanza and Isabel Segundo. The restaurants in Vieques generally were much better than we had imagined. (We visited a different one each night.) Criss-crossing the island, we also managed to visit, among others, the Inn on the Blue Horizon (right next door to the Hacienda Tamarindo), the Bravo Beach Hotel, the Hix Island House, the Finca del Caraibe and the old Martineau Bay Hotel, which is being converted into a W. Even after visiting the other properties, we remained delighted with the Hacienda Tamarindo.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Vieques and the Tamarido”
Reviews.Author: chas343
Reviews.Content: We spent four days and the Hacienda Tamarindo and really enjoyed the hotel and the island of Vieques. The rooms are large (at least ours was) and we had a great view of the water. Staff were extremely helpful, more than willing to book autos, restaurants, and attractions. They don't have a restaurant, but do serve breakfast, which was a bit of a disappointment, but not a real problem. Overall we loved the place. Local restaurants were quite god. El Quenepo was our favorite. We also ate at Blue Macaw, which was OK, nt too great, and Trade Winds, also good. If you are interested in the Bio Bay experience make sure you book your trip when there is no full moon. The Boat trip to bio bay doesn't run and the kayak trips are as satisfying. We went during a full moon, so I guess we will just have to go back, which I think we will.

Reviews.Title: “lovely inn”
Reviews.Author: tjmiller50
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hacienda for 4 nights in room #3. the inn is small and really charming with an honor bar and snack stop and a helpful and friendly staff. our room was just off the common area and small veranda ,which made it somewhat less than completely private but it had a great view looking south over the sea. vieques has some really terrific beaches, we found the sombe beach close to town a great one to walk on. you will need a vehicle on the island everything requires a drive from this inn. if quiet and nothing to do is your ideal vacation the hacienda would be a good bet. our best meals were at the tradewinds in esperanza. dont expect gourmet or fresh local cuisine and you wont be disappointed. we found no food , including the much praised breakfast at the inn that could not be found at any local dennys. still the inn was great.

Reviews.Title: “perfect small hotel”
Reviews.Author: LymeFolks
Reviews.Content: my husband and i recently returned from a 5 day vacation in vieques (our first time there.) we loved the island... the beaches, hiking on the west side, the friendly folks and horses, dogs & chickens all milling about amicably. we picked the hacienda tamarindo based on the reviews found here. every good thing they say is true: it's a charming setting, marvelously helpful & cheerful staff, and wonderful breakfasts (try the tamarind juice.) we stayed in the casa linda which is in a private setting away from the rest of the hotel. the casa linda has two bedrooms, one bath, a nice living room and a spacious kitchen, but the best part was the wrap-around porch which had a great view of the ocean and a non-stop sea breeze (which kept away any mosquitos that might have been out.) in addition to being the perfect setting for post-hiking margaritas, the porch & breeze came in handy for drying bathing suits :) we will definitely go back to vieques, hacienda tamarindo, and almost certainly stay in the same room/casa. the casa linda is pricey, but worth it. enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant and insulting owner”
Reviews.Author: Mr_MooCow
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed next door, but had an opportunity to interact with the Tamarindo's owner while we were trying to locate an adjacent business. We were confused as to the location of the desired business (we'd gotten directions from some folks and misunderstood them after seeing some nearby signage). We came across the owner (identity confirmed by our hosts) outside as we got out of our car. We asked him if the business we sought were co-located with the Tamarindo. Instead of saying "oh, you just passed it; it's at the bottom of the driveway", he replied by asking us where we'd seen the sign for the business, asking why we would think that the business was at the Tamarindo, etc.--this wasn't in a "how can we improve things to help folks out" way, but in a "why are you bothering me" way. When my wife tried to end his little tirade about our ignorance and confusion by politely saying "Thank you!", he persisted in berating us. We both wondered afterwards why such a person would ever enter the service industry, and wondered how he knew that we weren't potential guests. After reading other posts here, we're still wondering about the first question and now understand that he treats guests the same way.

Reviews.Title: “u”
Reviews.Author: lolamini
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 3 nights at the Hacienda Tamarindo in Vieques. After reading many other reviews on Trip Advisor, I concur that this is a gem of a place. It is in a beautiful setting - set up on a hill overlooking the ocean. The inn is a good-sized open structure, with patios overlooking the ocean and a (small) pretty pool facing the ocean as well. The rooms are spread throughout the first 2 floors of the hacienda, and all have louvered/shutter doors. Our room had a spectacular view of the water - when you opened the double-shuttered doors you could lie in bed and look out at the waves. Unbelievable. We had no AC in our room, just a ceiling fan, but at this time of year it was perfect. There are also strong cross-winds that come through the room so it was not too warm. The Inn makes a wonderful breakfast to order, set out on tables on a veranda. Everything is very open, with pretty views from all over. The staff was extremely helpful in making reservations at restaurants, advising us on which tour to book to the BIoBay (unfortunately, we saw nothing on our trip due to a full moon!), and the Inn lends its guests umbrellas and water-proof holders for money etc when going to the beach during the day. The beaches are beautiful, like a tropical postcard, with warm aqua water, very unspoiled with very few people. We had a wonderful dinner at the Blue Macau in Isabel Segunda on the other side of the island and a great chocolate molten dessert at the restaurant El Quenepo in Esperanza. This is not a "luxury" hotel if one is looking for that. But if you're looking for a tasteful, unique, lovely place to stay, then this is it. Keep in mind that in the room, the bathroom is minimal and small, and the door to the bathroom is simply a shuttered, louvered door, so there is not a lot of privacy. Also, perhaps my only negative comment it that we could have used more towels in the room. We had a leisurely and comfortable visit here, and thoroughly enjoyed the spectacular views from our room and the pool-side. We would highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: rubyss
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really lovely with friendly staff, great rooms, terrific pool and super honor bar. We had car trouble in that our car kept overheating. The folks at the front desk really helped us out by filling up our radiator with water, etc. The honor bar where they lay out lots of different liquors and mixers is really fun as you can experiment making different drinks and its very reasonably priced. Its true that if you're looking for a place with a TV you may want to look elsewhere. But who would come to Vieques for TV anyway? We hope to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: abopao
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place with gracious employees and knowledgable management. Jim gave us great information and made our stay exciting and full of fun. Can't wait for today's special for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: helloworldUsa
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting to be relaxing and do nothing but chill, then this is your place. If you don't expect TV/internet, then you are fine. The pool lights went off one night sometime before 9pm and there was no one insight to assist...including multiple phone calls to all of the numbers listed in the binder in the library and at the front desk. Although beach chairs and beach towels were available, the beach was far away. The room walls are thin. The honor bar was awesome. The full breakfast, that came with the room rate, was wonderful. We went with the cheapest priced room. Our room was spacious and had a beautiful view outside. Every where you turned, you will get a wonderful view...serenity...We enjoyed our r&r since our mentality was to lay back, chill-out and not to expect too much. I'm probably glad that I never met Burr, the owner, now that I've read the negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: GiacR
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing, no T.V., a pool, a view of the just the ocean a small town filled with locals, decent places to eat and no tourism. The rooms were great, we stayed in #22 and it was perfect. The breakfast was very good and included in the price. It is not a continental breakfast, but a full breakfast with pancakes and eggs, etc. This is a laid back island, so be prepared to just go with the flow and not worry to much about what is coming next. The beach is a bit of a walk and I suggest renting a car through the hotel. You NEED a car! I ignored this thinking that I could just walk, but to really see the beaches, you need a car or a scooter. Also, do the Bio Bay Tour through Island Adventures. That is a few steps from the hotel. They do an excellent job. I don't recommend doing the Kayak tour, a few of our group did and were literally eaten alive by the mosquitos b/c you kayak through the mangroves. You cannot use bug spray with DEET, it is against the law on Vieques. So they tell you to use baby oil...uh no! (This was another company that told me this, that is why I used Island Adventures). Go to Haciendo Tamarindo...you will not be disappointed. I think this was the place I have been looking for on all my previous vacations.

Reviews.Title: “HacTam - a lovely place with great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: dotska
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hacienda Tamarindo over Memorial in 2005. Yes a little late for a review, but I have been recently thinking about returning. We went for a wedding and stay 4 nights in a 2 room suite (3 adults in room total). The rooms and bathrooms were very clean. This is a small place so there are only small wall/window ac units. But we were never uncomfortable. The pool has the most scenic view and we loved the honor bar. Also our rental car was there upon arrival. We attending a wedding at the Inn on the Blue Horizon. I liked the hotel but if I return to Vieques, I would definitely stay at HacTam again. While the IotBH has a larger pool and the rooms are spread out and slightly more private... the breakfast at the HacTam cannot be beat! It was some of the best food we had in Vieques! Each morning the menu varied and everything was delicious. Also HacTam is right next to the Bio Bay center. I hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Suburbanbushbabe
Reviews.Content: I checked in to Hacienda Tamarindo for 3 nights after having stayed 2 nights at a small Guesthouse on the north side of the island that had Wifi and TV where I had been very, very comfortable. So I was a little surprised that my comparatively hefty room price didn't include either, and that there was no TV or internet access on the entire site. Aside from that, the place is fabulous! Hacienda Tamarindo is maybe 10 minutes slow drive away from Sombe, and close enough to the Esperanza Malecon action without being in the middle of it. My room had a private patio and an ocean view to. die. for. I've read other comments about noise bleeding into the rooms, and I can see how this could be an issue in the high season because all the rooms are louvered, but this was low season and I didn't have a problem. The pool is very lovely. I spent a lazy morning digesting the great breakfast and reading in one of the 2 hammocks slung in a lovely shaded area overlooking the pool. Everywhere you look there is beauty. Loved the honor bar and while there are no mini-fridges in the room there is a room cooler and unlimited ice. Beach chair and ample towels are provided. A full (inlcuded) breakfast is served from 8-10. One day, Margie one of the staff packed up a breakfast burrito to go for me so I could do a yoga class on the beach at Sombe. It was so good!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Samdad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an extra night on the island after renting a house for a week so we called Hacienda Tamarindo. Luckily, a room was available. This is just a fabulous place, quaint but not tiny, well-run with lots of amenities and a very relaxed atmosphere. The location is scenic and convenient to Esperanza. The ocean breezes were cool and non-stop, we had a room with air but didn't use it. Even if everything else had been mediocre, the terrific breakfast and swimming pool would have been worth the stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Hacienda Tamarindo”
Reviews.Author: PenelopeSC
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel - Excellent customer service, I can't express how helpful the staff was in pre arrival info. The island of Vieques is a perfect get away. We loved the combination of empty beaches, and delicious cuisine. Definitely rent a car, but watch out for horses in the road. And definitely take a trip to the bio bay - It is magical!

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Tamarindo Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: belleharbor
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Tamarindo was a wonderful place to experience Vieques. It is ideally situated, in that it's near the town of Esperanza but not too near. The breakfasts were very tasty and the specials each morning offer a variety of selections. We loved the fact that we were a five minute walk from the nearest beach which was often empty. This is the kind of place and island for people who aren't interested in big crowds and even larger resorts. It is very low key. The furnishings are lovely and tasteful. Joey, at the front desk, was particularly helpful. When I asked him where he would go for dinner he steered us to a place where we had a really good local experience. The coolers, towels and chairs in the room were very useful, especially the coolers which really did keep things icy cold with the help of the icemaker available 24/7 in the lobby. The honor bar is helplful when you just didn't find the time to stop somewhere for a cold drink. If you like small places to stay, Vieques is the island for you and Hacienda Tamarindo is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just What I Needed...”
Reviews.Author: EML_Athens
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect getaway! I work in the busy world of the hospitality industry and was ready for a little R & R myself and found Hacienda Tamarindo to do all of that and more! They were very helpful at the front desk with tips and places to see while on Vieques and every morning they would help you get off to a great start with a scrumptious breakfast ~ try the special of the day (they are GREAT!) They outfit the rooms with fun and classy decor and coolers (you will have to pick up a cold 6 pack of Medalla- the local beer), beach towels, and beach chairs. Very handy, considering you will be relaxing on the beautiful beaches all day. I know how hard it is to run and maintain a successful hotel and I am very picky when it comes to traveling because I know all there is to know about this business, and let me tell you that they know what they are doing down there in Vieques and I wouldn't stay anywhere else but Hacienda Tamarindo on my future trips to the island. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Second Time!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Hacienda Tamarindo. I would definitely stay there again. Both times we stayed in a Deluxe Caribbean room - large room, bathroom and a wonderful patio facing the Caribbean. Between the hotel and the sea is a lot a land with trees and ponds -- attracts lots of wild horses and birds. Fun to watch from the patio. Barkley the sheepdog is wonderful. He tries to connive you into letting him into the Air Conditioned library. He'll appear on the patio, then come visit inside the room. Shaboo the parrot is hysterical. He sits on the stair rail at breakfast whistling "Twinkle Twinkle Little Star" and shouts "Tickle, Tickle" when he wants to be tickled. The breakfast is is a full meal and will keep you going until a late lunch or dinner. Our routine was: breakfast at the hotel, then on to one of many gorgeous and deserted beaches. Then go to either Isabel Segunda or Esperanza for lunch, then go to a different beach until sundown. Last time we were in Vieques, the US Navy still kept most beaches blocked. This time we were able to visit Green, Red, Blue beaches along with Navio and Sun Bay. Our favorite was the one between Red and Blue -- not sure of the name. Involved climbing down a hill. Our only gripe about our stay had nothing to do with Hacienda Tamarindo, but rather with the neighboring property, Inn on the Blue Horizon. The Blue Horizon had an employee building some sort of housing structure very close to our room. His tools were powered by a generator that was extremely loud and ran on and off starting at 8 AM. We called the Blue Horizon and the guy actually stopped working. Maybe a coincidence?

Reviews.Title: “The full experience”
Reviews.Author: Chisalsera
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were very happy with our stay at "HacTam." The room and guesthouse were very well-decorated and comfortable. They had everything you needed: beach chairs, beach towels, flashlight, mini-fridge. The boxed lunches were not the tastiest, but it was very convenient and worthwhile. They had free internet access which was a nice convenience to check on things at home (if you have to) or research things on the island. We loved the breakfast. The pool was gorgeous and I love that they don't have rules about how late you can swim (it was great for late night dips before bed). Our room was near the kitchen (#27) and like other people have mentioned it was noisy in the morning as they prepared breakfast (in the room with the two twins - it was OK in the master bedroom). The service was pretty good overall, but could have been a little better. There were a few issues ... nothing huge but it could have been handled slightly better. The location was great- just far enough from "the strip" to feel like a getaway yet close enough to walk if necessary (bring those flashlights at night!!)

Reviews.Title: “We loved everything”
Reviews.Author: Dbuoy1961
Reviews.Content: This is one of our all time favorite places that we have stayed. Burr and his staff have thought of everything you might need for a wonderful, relaxing, beach get-away, all the way down to the fully stocked honor bar, cooler in room and beach chairs to take to the beautiful beaches, to the flash light and umbrella if needed. The food at breakfast was a daily treat but fell in love with Barkley, the resident ever welcoming sheepdog. Loved the parrot too, but not as Kissie as Barkley. Great location on the island. Trade-winds great restaurant with beautiful sunsets. The Marauder sailboat snorkeling trip, the best we have done in the Caribbean, bar none. And Bio Bay,,,what can I say but "oh my god" this was the very best trip of all, do not, repeat do not miss this. Plan on going on a moonless night if possible and prepare for a swim of a lifetime. Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderous Place”
Reviews.Author: EricTraveling
Reviews.Content: I have been here three times now and each time, I realize I love this island and this inn even more. It is hard to image a more perfect spot--an island that is like a Caribbean version of Vermont--lush, rolling mountains, long country roads, horses gnawing at open fields of grass. And there, atop a hill, overlooking an endless expanse of deep blue sea, is Hacienda Tamarindo. The house is feels like an extension of the natural world, with the tamarindo tree growing right through its center, the rooms all have lots windows that make you almost feel like you are staying outside. It can be noisy--the crickets, birds, roosters. But it is noise of nature. Nothing at all bothersome. The honor bar in the lobby is always open. The pool sits there, rarely used, but very inviting. Everything you could want is lined up: the ice chest, the beach chairs, the beach towels, the packed lunches (if you want). It is really, at least for us, a way to walk into a dream. The breakfast is always delicious, fresh, tasty. Best part of all Vieques. So many spots of extraordinary beauty. Long roads over a mountain top--like a roller coaster--the ocean visible from a distance, the lush tropical forest laid out before you, then you pull up to a beach, and it is like you are Tom Hanks, in Cast Away. You get the picture. Just don' t tell too many people about this place. Would hate it if it got too crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Rave Review:”
Reviews.Author: 3_JBK
Reviews.Content: We found the Hacienda Tamarindo marvelous. We were five adults (in our mid 50â€™s) traveling together and we couldnâ€™t ask for a better place to stay. The Hacienda is full of antiques and very pleasing to the eye. The place was extremely clean and the staff was very accommodating. The pool was wonderful and the view was breathtaking. We rented a car, and other than the trip from the ferry to the Hacienda, the restaurants & beaches were all about 10-15 minutes away. We enjoyed Shaboo the parrot and Barkley the old English Sheep dog, permanent residents of the Hacienda. An extremely nice touch is the full breakfast, included in the rate. Go for the breakfast special, they were incredible. If your spending the day at the beach, order the box lunch. (it's so nicely packaged, you won't want to eat it) This was a true jewel on this lovely island. I would strongly recommend the Hacienda Tamarindo if youâ€™re looking for a relaxing, beautiful place to stay on this lovely island. Julie & Bob from Long Island, New York

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Adventure_awaits
Reviews.Content: Thanks to others who wrote reviews; your recommendations led me here and I've enjoyed it! We stayed five nights and loved every moment here. Our clean, comfortable room has a balcony with incredible views. The staff are friendly and there are touches to make you feel welcome everywhere... from the always open honor bar to boxed lunches for the beach ... to Barkley (their friendly dog who loves the air conditioned library), Samboo the parrot who greets you with at least a hello and goodbye each time you come in... to the scrumptious breakfasts. There is Internet access and wi-fi, for those who miss contact with the off-island world. This is the quiet season, so we had the place all to ourselves at least one night. We highly recommend it... and its just up the hill from the Island Adventure biobay tour, which is not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time to be had at Tamarindo”
Reviews.Author: HRod48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 days (July 16-19)on Vieques at the Hacienda and hated leaving. The hotel lived up to expectations with the staff exceeding them. We quickly upgraded our room to the suite, not because anything was wrong with our first room but to get a private balcony. Our packed picnic lunches each day on a different beach, mostly by ourselves and this during Padrones (festival week) were just what we wanted, and the recommendations for dinner to Media Luna, Trade Wind, and esp. to Bili were right on. As everyone says, Biobay is unique that must be experienced to be believed. The 2nd half of our trip was to a fancy "private island" in the BVI which was totally different, very enjoyable, and luxurious, but not nearly the fun we had on Vieques at Hacienda Tamarindo.

Reviews.Title: “How could you not love this place?”
Reviews.Author: happycook
Reviews.Content: We are a fairly consumer-savvy family (okay - picky!) with two hulking teenage boys and do love to travel. Tamarindo grows on you very, very fast as an incredibly thoughtfully organised haven for a million tiny reasons. Favourite memory is curling up reading in the very pretty guests' library after a midnight dip in the hotel's exquisite pool the night we had done the Vieques Bio Bay canoe trip -( as others have said, the latter is THE Mother Nature Puerto Rico experience of a lifetime) - wondering what superb breakfast I'd order the next day. The staff were terribly kind and adorable - with the curious exception of the cross housekeeper who "welcomed" us - who gave the impression of being a complete battleaxe! Possibly she was just having a bad day. We spent 15 days "doing" PR, and Tamarindo was in our top three (along with The Gallery Inn in Old San Juan and the incredible Casa Grande mountain retreat). You must have a car on the island - but the Tamarindo pool and location will keep you happy anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Joel_Maners
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying on our second floor room (number 23). The doors and windows are all louvered so there was not much to keep out noise. Since breakfast was served outside our door each morning, we were woken several times by noisy guests. There was also a nice porch with chairs just outside our door. A couple of mornings some guests sat outside our window and chatted. One morning a lady sat out there chatted and talked on her cell phone for about 15 minutes. It got to be very annoying. If you want more peace and quiet, request a room on a lower floor. Room 5, overlooking the pool looked to be the best in my opinion. The breakfast was fantastic. Each morning, they had a special or you could order an omlett any way you liked. You could also get fresh fruit, cereal, coffee, fruit juice, and either toast or an English muffin. Everything was very tasty. The spicy hash browns were also an unusual treat. We usually had enough to save for lunch later in the day. Each room was furnished with folding beach chairs and towels, which you could take with you to the beach. Each room also had a small cooler for filling with ice and drinks. You could even request a box lunch to take with you the next day. The order sheet had to be turned in the night before. The cost was $8.50 per lunch. We never had to order one since the breakfast was so ample. We took the savings and splurged on dinner at a nice restaurant. The staff was perhaps the best aspect of the inn. They made recommendations and reservations at restaurants each night. They even arranged for a rental jeep for us and had it waiting when we got there. Burr Vail, one of the proprietors was available to provide advice and directions throughout the day. We couldn't have asked for a more helpful and welcoming staff.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Hacienda Tamarindo!”
Reviews.Author: 4adventures
Reviews.Content: Lovely place to stay. Beautiful guesthouse. The pool is gorgeous and nice to take a swim, at night especially. It's open 24 hours. The breakfasts are great. The rooms are large and clean. We had a view of the Caribbean in #23. Amazing! The resident dog, Barkley is very laid back and a nice addition, as well as the parrot. The staff were helpful and friendly. We really enjoyed our stay at the Tamarindo and Vieques was great! We would stay her again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, lovely place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hacienda Tamarindo and found it nearly impossible to leave this lovely place. From check-in to check-out, everything was just right. The staff is friendly and helpful, the Hacienda pets are awesome (hello, Barkley!), the setting couldn't be more tranquil and beautiful. We had a 2-room suite for my husband and I and my mother-in-law and it worked out perfectly. The main bedroom of the suite is amazing, with a high ceiling and a view over the grounds and lovely pool. Breakfasts are fantastic -- more than enough to see you through lunchtime, but the staff can also make you picnic lunches to take along to the beach. Vieques itself is very quiet, undeveloped (so far) -- no chain restaurants, no El Wal-Mart, no nightclubs. Please don't go to Vieques if you are going to complain about the lack of "things to do"! The beaches are glorious, the people are wonderful, the food is delicious -- it is just a kick-back and really relax place. Do not miss the Bio Bay tour under any circumstances -- go with Island Adventures, right next to Hacienda Tamarindo and you will have one of the most magical adventures of your life.

Reviews.Title: “Yo quiero Hacienda Tamarindo!”
Reviews.Author: ejcrowe
Reviews.Content: We (my husband, his granddaughter and her mother) chose Hacienda Tamarindo and stayed in a 2-room suite. The property is beautiful with gorgeous views of the Caribbean. Our room was one of the few featured on the website, though the dÃ©cor has been updated considerably, and it was quite comfortable, composed of a king-size bedroom with two very nice armoires, a sitting room with two twin-size daybeds, and a bathroom connecting the two. Only the main bedroom had a/c, but the staff thoughtfully provided a floor fan, which, combined with the ceiling fan, cooled the sitting room sufficiently for sleeping. Unfortunately, our room was adjacent to the kitchen and breakfast area, and since the door to the room was a louvered door, quite a bit of noise filtered through in the mornings. Though to be fair, it didnâ€™t seem as loud as the roosters outdoors, and my husband and I didnâ€™t hear it at all in our bedroomâ€”it was just the sitting room that was affected. After getting off to a shaky start with a certain staff member (she actually told me that she had received an email I sent the day before departure but didnâ€™t bother to read or respond to it since I would be there the next day! The email was a request for 4 packed lunches since we would arrive mid-afternoon and might be too tired to drive someplace to get a late lunch.), we very quickly warmed to the place. We were all charmed by Barkley, the resident Old English Sheepdog, and Shaboo, the brightly colored parrot. Not to mention the staff, including the aforementioned woman, who were all a delight. The pool area was a real oasis, with a shaded pergola and chaises at one end and a vista overlooking the green hills rolling down to the Caribbean at the other. There were two hammocks strung in shaded areas beside the pool, a water fountain incorporated into the pool that muffled voices very effectively, and two small bench-like alcoves set into the deep end of the pool that were perfect for sitting and reading so that oneâ€™s bottom half was submerged while oneâ€™s torso was above the waterline. One thing I really liked about the property was that there seemed to be plenty of private spaces, both sunny and shaded, for tete-a-tetes. Some overlooked the pool, others faced out over the gardens or had views of the Caribbean, but all were nicely situated for privacy. Romantic couples would definitely have no problem finding a space for just themselves. Another thing I really liked were the decorative touches here and there, unexpected little pieces, ranging from an antique wheelchair parked in a corner, to a tiled fountain at the entrance, to a Janus-head hanging up near the breakfast area. The honor bar was also very handy to have around, as we could just make our own drinks and record them in a notebookâ€”however, I would have enjoyed having a blender there to make frozen drinks, and there was no ice cream in the freezer as described on the website. There was also a small air-conditioned sitting room with a lending library, decent selection of board games, and a computer with high-speed access for guest use. Breakfast is included in the room price at HacTam, so we ate there every morning before heading out. The menu consists of toast, various kinds of eggs, fruit, a choice of meat, hot or cold cereals, various juices, and a daily special. Iâ€™m trying to lose a bit of weight, so I opted for fruit and cold cereals until our last day when the special was French toast stuffed with cream cheese and guavaâ€”tell me, dear reader, what would YOU have ordered? I simply had to do it, and it was delicious. I sampled the others' omelets, eggs Benedict, and spicy hash browns and they were all very good. HacTam is just a short walk away from the Inn on the Blue Horizon, which is where we went to eat upon arrival. The email that I had sent requesting lunches on the first day was ignored, so we were grateful to have a place we could grab lunch without having to sort through the rental car process first. We did order the lunches for the next day, which were a disappointment, I'm sorry to say. Three out of the four sandwiches were made incorrectly, and the bread was stale on all of them. Still, we were happy to have them to snack on whilst out exploring the deserted beaches with no facilities--and the fruit and the packaged chips and cookies were all just fine. It's a great concept they have going with the cooler backpack, but based on our one experience with it, it could stand some more attention to detail. All in all, we were extremely pleased with the HacTam. It has a wonderful charm that, if you let it, will ease into your body and mind and embrace you with its serenity. My husband and I will definitely return, and his daughter made a reservation for a stay later this summer before we departed. Despite the small setbacks upon our arrival, I would still rate our experience with 5 stars (or circles, as they use here on TripAdvisor).

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Tamarindo made our trip memorable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to get away for a few days before a conference in San Juan. Getting to Vieques on the new high speed ferry from Old San Juan was simple. The people at the Hacienda Tamarindo were extremely helpful in arranging for a rental car (a must to get around to beaches, restaurants) and a trip to the Bioluminescent Bay. The Hacienda is beautiful and well maintained. Our room had a private balcony looking out over the fields to the ocean. The pool is lovely. The breakfast was excellent. One of the best deals on the whole island is the "box lunch" offered by the hotel. For $8.50 they pack up a sandwich, fruit, chips and cookie in a backpack cooler. Add some drinks to the cooler in each room and it is easy to spend the day at any beach. The hotel provides beach towels and chairs for guests to take with them for the day. Vieques has beautiful beaches, wild horses, and lots of birds. The Bioluminescent Bay is a once in a lifetime opportunity. There is virtually no shopping and only a couple of dozen restaurants on the whole island. It is a place to go to relax and leave behind the bustle of the city. We would definitely go again to the Hacienda Tamarindo.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay at the Tamarindo”
Reviews.Author: MomMonroe
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Hacienda Tamarindo. It is a lovely setting, and the location is both quiet and close to the sea (a rare combination). The hacienda and grounds were clean, well-tended, and charming; the staff was friendly and helpful; the food for breakfast and boxed lunch was very tasty. I spent some time looking at Tamarindo's website before our trip, wondering how the real thing would compare. I must say, in real life it's even nicer. Being kind of new to the guest house concept, I was surprised at how close some rooms were to the common areas (our room opened to the front lobby), but really the only noise we heard came from the sea. Not too bad, huh? We would happily stay at Tamarindo again. The Crow's Nest looked like another rewarding spot. Although it isn't close to the sea, it has two of the island's best restaurants on-site, which is a big advantage. It's also located in between Esperanza and Isabel II which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I hoped for”
Reviews.Author: MDtraveller2
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hacienda at the end of February and loved it. This was our first trip to Vieques and based on advice on this forum we chose the Hacienda. We were looking for a quiet place with a pool and a view of the ocean. It was perfect. The Hacienda is a beautiful building and its decorated with lovely antiques and art work. I loved the resident dog, Barkley, cat and bird. (If you don't like animals, I wouldn't go there.) The honor bar was resonably priced and we took advantage of it on more than one occasion. Especially after touring the biobay. You get back around 9pm and there aren't too many places open to eat. They arranged our rental car and everything went smoothly. We did get a pinhole leak in the tire and we noticed it going flat one morning. Burr, the owner, helped us find an air compressor to fill it and we were able to get it back to the rental place (Martineau Car Rental) and they changed it in about 20 minutes. No hassle. The orientation to the island is worth it. You find out a lot of useful info on restaurants and how to get to the secluded beaches. I would avoid Bili restaurant in Esperanza.
