The service was really bad. Not just Vieques slow, but bad. We had 3 different waiters who didn't seem to know what they were doing and the food made me sick. I loved Vieques and the Hacienda and will go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat over rated”
Reviews.Author: SDT
Reviews.Content: Vieques is beautiful and as wonderful and everyone says. After all the great reviews for this place, I booked the top room in the hotel (Carribean Deluxe Suite) even though it was very expensive ($275 per night). I was very dissapointed. Only the living room faces the sea. The large bedroom has a wall of window facing a hedge that blocks a road. While the road is not used much, when a car or truck went by it was as if they were in the room. Even more dissapointing is that there are 2 central air conditioners right outside of the room. When these turned on, it eliminated and possibility of enjoying the room. They are loud and overwhelm the night sounds. We actually has to run our A/C to be able to sleep. Unless these air conditioners are moved, I would recommend people avoid this room. Other rooms also have problems. Many enter through the breakfast area so you are up at 7:30AM. Others have no privacy at all if you open your shutters. Finally, we signed up for the owners introduction which is set up for 10 and found it very boring and excessively long. He rambled on for 2 hours and basically wasted the fist morning of our trip. A simple overview of the island while checking in would be much more appropriate, and people looking for more discussion with the owner can do so. Choices on Vieques are limited, and with the right room this can be a nice place to stay. Just be sure you ask a lot of questions and specify what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Bed and Breakfast Carribean Style”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hacienda for our 21st anniversary January 16-19, 2006 and loved it. This inn is not for the "high-rise" traveler. It is cozy, welcoming and is decorated lovingly by its owners with an eclectic collection of art and hand-crafted treasures. Our gracious and knowledgeable hosts, Linda and Burr, WERE available for advice and suggestions for meals and sight-seeing. Joey and Jim, our concierges, were helpful with reservations for jeep rentals(must do), dinners(Trade Winds, Cafe Media Luna), and the bio-bay tour (must, must do). The rooms and views are beautiful (suggest room 23, Caribbean Deluxe). Full breakfast is yummy...big and filling (the condensed version of the Times is great) and the girls will cook up anything you like (within reason) and pack you box lunches for the beach.Even if you have an early flight home, they won't send you away hungry. Don't miss Burr's orientation...he is a plethera of information: funny, useful, historical and bizarre. Take advantage of the honor bar: sign out some drinks and sit by the beautiful pool overlooking the caribbean when you arrive..wonderful. You can walk to the seaside town of Esperanza for dinner and more drinks within 10 minutes...very safe, but the road is a little dark after sundown. The Inn, the people, the views, the location, the whole island is beautiful and make for an extraordinary vacation for anyone loving quiet beauty. Highly recommended, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Tamarindo is great!”
Reviews.Author: shortiekp
Reviews.Content: Very well run and clean hotel with nice comforts and a beautiful pool! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not really near the beach--need a scooter or good walking shoes to get to the nearest shoreline. View is limited at best. Located next to the Bio Bay tour meeting place--noisy with school buses busing people in and out all night. First impression of the owner: I had the pleasure of seeing him in action at a local restaurant in town--he called the chef a ------- idiot in front of everyone. (The restaurant ran out of some of its dishes due to the fact that the Blue Macaw's kitchen burned to the ground the night before, thus overcrowding the remaining restaurants in town) The Hacidena's owner proceeded to physically attack the chef in front of a full restaurant. Ruined everyone's evening. At first, I thought he was a disgruntled tourist--but once I found out he was actually a fellow proprieter causing a scene I realized that the postings here were right. I don't know why anyone would spend the money to stay at an establishment where the owner has such hostility. Please stay somewhere else!!!! (You want to have a nice, happy vacation, right????)

Reviews.Title: “Your own paradise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from Vieques that we absolutely loved! We stayed in Hacienda for 7 nights. This was by far one of the best boutique hotels that we have stayed in so far. Hacienda owners (Linda and Burr) are the most gracioius hosts and so is the entire stuff. The view from our room was magnificent, room was very cozy and nicely decorated, bed very comfortable. Although there were problems with water supplies on the island, we never experienced any shortage. Hacienda has a look and feel of a friend's home where you feel welcomed and comfortable. There is a full bar where you can fix yourself a drink 24hr/day, there is a library where you can borrow a book or a table game. The breakfast in the morning is wonderful, featuring a special every morning. You have two beach chairs and the cooler in the room that you can take with you to the beach. In addition, you can order lunch the night before that will be prepared for you in the morning, which you can also take to the beach. The pool is beutiful and for you to use 24hr/day. We absolutely loved the pets in Hacienda - Barley (the dog), Shaboo (the parrot) and wonderful kitty (can't remember the name). Shaboo greets everyone on most mornings and sings songs for guest's entertainment. Hacienda is also convinently located a short work from Inn on the Blue Horizon (where you can get dinner or a drink at night) and next door to the place that runs tours to Bioluminscent Bay. There were only 3 negative aspects to our stay in Hacienda. 1) breakfast is only two hours b/w 8-10 and if you missed it, tough luck 2) there is no coffee maker in the room, so if you want tea in the evening, you might not be able to get it, 3) you are not told that you are going to be charged service fee (for room cleaning, various tips, etc). The amount is some percentage from the cost of your room. Overall however, it was a very pleasurable experience. We would want to return.

Reviews.Title: “very very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first 4night of our honeymoon. It was wonderful. The staff was very helpful and drove us to the rental car location, they also helped us set of a bio bay tour. Super helpful staff. The dog and bird that live at the Inn were also so funny. Our roomwas always clean. The breakfast served on the terrace was delicious. Our room was one of the few that had a patio! I think it was #6? Vieques was a wonderful place to visit and just enjoy the ocean and relax. The only downside of this hotel was that we were not told that gratuity is included (15% per night). We had been tipping the servers at breakfast and no one ever told us.... oh well. we would go back

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is not worth the amount money per night they ask for. The rooms look clean, but are dirty, and the staff is not the friendliest (especially the one serving breakfast in the mornings). You can hear everything that goes on late at night (drunks playing in the pool) and nothing was done about it. The absurd amount that you pay is for the upkeep of antiques that they use to furnish their hacienda. I know there are not a lot of options on Vieques, but I would suggest going to the Inn at the Blue instead.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to our next visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hacienda Tamarindo in March 2004. Burr Vail and his staff's hospitality made us feel very welcome. Even before we showed up, Burr was answering questions and helping us plan our visit to Vieques. Breakfast is unbelievable- lots of choices, everything delicious. The rooms are very attractive and comfortable.The inn has lots of fun antiques, a nice pool, a beach to walk along down below, a good restaurant next door, and is just far enough out of town to be completely peaceful. The loudest thing we heard was Shaboo the parrot when we got him to chatter with us. This is an inn where you know you are being taken good care of and that your pleasure is their priority.

Reviews.Title: “Found Paradise at Hacienda Tamarindo”
Reviews.Author: UrbanGuru
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at Hacienda Tamarindo. We loved our time there, and we will definitely return. The Inn is beautifully designed, and has lovely landscaping around the pool and the grounds. The views of the Caribbean and countryside are breathtaking. We stayed in a Caribbean Deluxe Room, which was spacious and comfortable. The furnishings included antiques, as well as other tasteful details. Double doors open to a sweeping view of the Caribbean, framed by bougainvillea branches just outside. Breakfast (included in the price) is provided from 8 to 10 am at the outdoor dining area; it was delicious and served by a friendly and efficient staff. Pitchers of coffee, hot milk, and tea water were set out at 6:15am for those early-rising guests who wanted to experience the day at its most serene and dramatic moment--the sunrise. After breakfast, we drove to one of the island's many picturesque beaches to swim, sun, and explore. In the late afternoon, we sat by the Hacienda's lovely pool, relaxing with other guests and taking in the view. Or we would sit on the terrace just off the lobby, feel the tradewinds and again--take in the incredible view! Burr Vail's (Innkeeper) orientation to the Island--a one hour session on the history, ecology, sightseeing and restaurants of Vieques-- was extremely helpful. We also enjoyed meeting other guests of the Inn. In its design and layout, the place really allows guests to choose solitude and privacy--or to interact with others, depending on what you're up for. Shaboo, the Parrot, most likely will greet you enthusiastically whenever you pass by, as well as whistling bars from Twinkle Twinkle Little Star. A few additional notes: (1) There are almost no accommodations directly on the beautiful swimming beaches of Vieques, which is part of the reason they remain as gorgeous and unspoiled as they are. It was nice to be up close and personal with the beach during the day's adventures, and to be able to take in the astounding, more distant panorama of land and sea when back at the Inn; (2) we stayed our last night in a room facing the parking lot, because our first room was not available for our full stay. It was spacious and lovely, and we didn't find it to be noisy at all. However, we did miss having a view; (3) You need a car on Vieques, and there are a limited number available for rent. Make sure you reserve one before you show up on the island. The Hacienda Tamarindo staff will help you with this.

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Tamarindo was heavenly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the lovely island of Vieques and a heavenly stay at Hacienda Tamarindo. We found the whole set up to be enchanting -- welcoming shaded terraces with ocean views , large rooms filled with antiques , the "honor bar", the library filled with good books, the hilltop location overlooking the Carribean with cooling tradewinds (no a.c. is necessary with the high ceilings , overhead fans ) , huge comfortable beds, ample towels, a gorgeous swimming pool with vistas to St Croix, nooks and crannies around the property with chairs to settle into, delicious home cooked breakfast (included in the room rate ) and all under the care of the delightful Burr and Linda Vail who made us feel very at home and were a pleasure to chat with about the island . HT is not on the beach but almost nothing is on the beach on the South side of Vieques which is much less developed and to us more beautiful than the North side where the Wyndham is (next to the airport) . It is like Martha's Vineyard with a Latin twist . There are 7 beautiful white sand beaches within a few minutes drive --a different one each day . Tamarindo is for us a great memory and we are looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed several times at Tamarindo and now my vision of paradise is forever married to my experience in Vieques. Breath-taking views, beautiful spacious rooms, and charming staff are just the beginning of Hacienda Tamarindo. This enchanting hotel lulled me into a rhythm of relaxation. Hammocks and the 80 degree weather aside....my favorite part was breakfast. Fresh tropical fruit salad, GREAT coffee, and all sorts of ingenious dishes...served by the local staff. This place is most certainly heaven on earth.

HotelInfo.Name: Hacienda Tamarindo
